El negocio ha crecido, por ello decidió ampliar su casa. Tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, quienes ahora le apoyan en el negocio y las actividades de la casa, su meta es tener una cebicheria bien implementada con un grato ambiente y poder dar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y a la vez dar trabajo a personas de la comunidad. Con el préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/ 800.00 ( $ 250.00 ), mejorará el ambiente que tiene en su propia casa, donde por las tarde y noches desarrolla su negocio, pintará el local con colores apropiados para este tipo de negocio, comprará manteles y vidrios para sus mesas, también se implementará con platos, cubiertos, y productos que diariamente necesita para preparar los diversos platos que vende, como arroz en sacos, maíz para los tamales, aceite y otros.

loans.use: Improve ambiance and purchase supplies for eatery

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en: A. Hargiz is 57-years old, married and the mother of nine children. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Lachin region, situated in the West of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Right now she lives in Sumqayit city. She is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. Nargiz has a small flock of sheep. She buys lambs and raises them for sale 6 months later. She sells the sheep in the local market, buys other lambs, and spends the rest of her profits on the necessities of life for her family. The business is very interesting but sometimes demands more funding than she has available. Her husband helps her in this work. In 2004 Hargiz borrowed $500 from Normicro and expanded her business. She would like to receive $1,000 loan in order to acquire 5 small sheep and feed for them. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She eventually hopes to expand this business. She hopes that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 small sheep and feed for them

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Isaac Blankson is a carpenter who manufactures all kinds of furniture. He is married with five children. The wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, milo, soaps etc. He works very hard to support the wife since the wife’s income is low. He also makes coffins and supplies organizations with all kinds of furniture.
He is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group”. The members of this group have known each other for many years and they provide support for each other as they are all located at the same place – Yamoransa – Accra Highway.
One challenge that Issac faces is that organizations and individuals always ask him to make furniture for them but because of the high cost of wood, foams, leathers and the materials used, he sometimes loses his customers to his competitors because they have been able to secure loans from some financial organizations.
As a result, Philip needs a loan of US $ 1,100 dollars to purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools and the material used in the manufacturing of the furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools and materials for making furniture

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia is an exemplary daughter and sacrificing mother. Her husband abandoned her when her son Rodrigo was just born, and now he is two years old. Since then, with much strength and perseverance, she decided to continue on with her son and her aged parents, who at all times have given her unconditional support. This hardworking mother, as daughter of great ceramic artesans, decided to use her knowledge, demonstrating her qualities and abilities for this splendid art, designing a great variety of piggy banks, decorative pieces, flower vases, etc. Eulalia’s wish is to export her merchandise. She is sure that with her will, a lot of effort, and above all with your support she will be able to make her dreams reality and thereby finally offer a better quality of life to her son and her dear parents who are the reason for her continuous efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia, es una ejemplar hija y sacrificada madre. Su esposo la abandonó cuando apenas nació su pequeño niño Rodrigo, que ahora tiene dos añitos, desde entonces con mucha más fuerza y perseverancia decidió progresar en compañía de su hijo y de sus ancianos padres, quienes en todo momento le brindaron su apoyo incondicional.Esta laboriosa madre, como hija de grandes artesanos en cerámica, decidió sacar a flote sus conocimientos, demostrando de esa manera sus cualidades y habilidades para este esplendoroso arte, diseñando así gran variedad de alcancías, adornos decorativos, floreros, etc.El deseo de Eulalia es exportar su mercadería, ella está segura que con su voluntad, mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo con tu desinteresado apoyo podrá concretar sus pretensiones y así finalmente ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida su hijo y a sus queridos padres quienes son la razón de su continuo esfuerzo.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of raw materials in order to continue making her beautiful articles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more land to expand stone quarry business

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy E.  is a trader who sells farm products like plantain, Banana. She is also a fishmonger who buys the fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and then later sells them to her costumers. She wishes to increase her sales in order to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

She is requesting a loan of $525 as an additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Mr. Luis Alberto C. L. is an agricultural and livestock producer who has worked 100% since his very early youth on his agricultural and livestock production. He is a family man and feels responsible to maintain his two children who need help on their education because they are minors.

His wife is a very hardworking woman who also supports him on his production activities in order to improve their lives and be able to go on with their family life. Aware of the needs his family is going through, Mr. Luis Alberto has been demanding loans from CEPRODEL for the last 9 years. He has used those loans to buy seeds for harvest and to buy kettle for raising. He comes to Ceprodel today again to ask for a loan that may allow him to go on with his business and give his very beloved family the support they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

El señor Luis Alberto C. L., es un productor agropecuario que ha trabajado desde su juventud cien por ciento en sus actividades agrícolas, pecuarios y crianza de animales. Es un padre de familia con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos hijos los cuales demandan apoyo en su educaron porque son menores de edad.

Su esposa es una dama muy esforzada que también lo apoya en su actividad económica para lograr sacar adelante su hogar y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia. Consiente de la necesidad que atraviesa su familia, el señor Luis Alberto desde hace 9 años ha realizado créditos en CEPRODEL los cuales le han permitido la compra de granos para la cosecha y además la compra de ganado para su respectiva crianza. Hoy en día una vez mas acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita continuar con su negocio y de esta manera brindarle el oportuno apoyo a su familia que tanto ama mucho.

loans.use: To buy seeds for harvest and kettle

loans.name: Salama's Tujieumishe Group

texts.en:
Salama, age 50, is a widow who cares for her three children, ages 4, 3 and 2. She makes a living selling charcoal and works from 7am to 9pm daily. From this business, which started 5 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $45.

Salama hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She is a member of the Tujieumishe loan group and will be sharing this loan with Chsum, another group member. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yacoubou

texts.fr:
Mr. Ycoubou A., a laboratory technologist, was born on December 10, 1974 in Anonoé in the county of Wawa. He is married and the father of three children. In 1990, after having obtained his degree, he opened a clinic called "Clinique Gracia" in the Bè neighborhood in Lomé. Sometimes he has difficulties with medical equipment.

This first loan that he is requesting will permit him to acquire a microscope and reagents so that he can better care for his patients.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Yacoubou est un laborantin né le 10 décembre 1974 à Anonoé dans la préfecture de Wawa. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. En 1990 après l’obtention de son diplôme de fin d’étude, il a ouvert une clinique dénommée « CLINIQUE GRACIA » dans le quartier de Bè à Lomé. Parfois il est confronté aux difficultés d’équipement médical.

Le premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir un microscope et des réactifs pour pouvoir mieux prendre soins de ses patients.

loans.use:
Purchase of a microscope

Achat d'un microscope

loans.name: Mary Ngwe

texts.en:
Mary Ngwe N. was born in 1947. She is a widow and mother of eight children. Her nightmare came true when her husband died, leaving her alone with the children. She is very hardworking. She has been farming crops like cassava since she was eight because her father died and she was unable to continue her education. She has struggled since the death of her husband, since her brother-in-law claimed almost all the property her husband left for her and the children.

Mary became a member of GHAPE three years ago. Since then, she has undergone training and taken loans for up to $400. She invested these loans in rearing fowl and pigs and the cultivation of crops including cassava, plantains, and beans. The profit from these loans were used to educate her children and satisfy basic needs for her family such as clothing and food.

If given this loan, Mary plans to invest it in farming cassava, rearing pigs and fowl, as well as operating a small restaurant. She is convinced that her business is going to succeed because she has livestock and business training. There is high demand for meat in her community and she is well known for producing the best fowl and pigs in her community. She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: to farm cassava and rear pigs and fowl

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
Fayssal, 47 years old, is married with 4 children. He lives with his family in the North of Lebanon.

Fayssal needs a loan of $1,200 so he has enough capital to purchase a small van. He has a business selling sweets and he would like to use the van so he can drive from village to village and sell his sweets.

This is the first time Fayssal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. He promises to repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To purchase a minivan to distribute sweets

loans.name: Ronald Cesar

texts.es:
Ron is 24 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. He works as a driver of his own daily bus. He has joined forces with his brother to manage the daily bus and transport passengers. He also supports his parents with their own bus, which operates during the free days. In this way, he feels productive for his family. He has done this for 10 years since he first learned how to drive and thanks his father for having trained him. Now, he supports his parents in support.

The reason for his effort is to have economic security, by which he supports his family.

Ronald requested this loan to repair the failing engine in his bus. His wish for the future is to purchase another type of microbus.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Ronald tiene 24 años, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Trabaja diariamente como chofer de su propia movilidad (combi), junto con su hermano, se han asociado para manejar esta movilidad interdiario, haciendo transporte de pasajeros, también apoya en el trabajo a sus padres con otra movilidad, que conducir cuando los días libres, así se siente productivo para su familia, viene haciendo esto, desde hace 10 años cuando aprendió a conducir y agradece a su padre por haberlo instruido y ahora él es parte sustentadora, que retribuye diariamente a sus ancianos padres.

El motivo de su esfuerzo es tener seguridad económica, para cuando se case cuente con el sostenimiento para su familia.

Ronald solicita este préstamo para reparara su movilidad, su motor está fallando, su deseo a futuro es obtener otra movilidad tipo combi.

loans.use: Repairing his vehicle to transport passengers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of meat and fruits for her small business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 33 años de edad, curso hasta el tercero de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, vive el Jr. Ica s/n, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y desde hace un año es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel”. 

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/.300, compró verduras, papa, carne, etc.,  para seguir preparando viandas (comida). Se dedica a este negocio desde hace varios años. Sus padres no tenían medios económicos y por esa razón no pudo concluir sus estudios secundarios y ello la obligó a trabajar desde los 20 años de edad. A esa edad empezó a vender comida en el mercado y a los 26 años formó su hogar y continuó con su negocio; ella decidió seguir adelante.

Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará  arroz, verduras, carne, aceite, azúcar, gas, etc.

“Gracias a los créditos que obtuve de los Bancos Comunales  podemos seguir adelante y ya no dependemos de nuestros esposos”, manifestó Yolanda.

Su mayor deseo es tener un Restaurante y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 33, went to 3rd grade of secondary school, lives with her partner, has four small children, lives in Jr. Ica, district of Ilave, province of El Collao, Puno and has been a member of the community bank “ San Miguel” for a year. At the beginning, with a $100 loan, she bought vegetables, potatoes, meat, etc, to continue preparing food. She has worked on this business for a few years. Her parents didn’t have the means and that’s why she couldn’t finish secondary school and that forced her to work since she was 20. At that age she started selling food in the market and at 26 she started a home and continued with the business, she decided to keep going. With this loan of $275, to be repaid in three months, she will buy rice, vegetables, meat, oil, sugar, gas, etc. “Thanks to the loans from the community banks we can keep going and we don’t depend on our husbands anymore”, said Yolanda. Her biggest wish is to have a restaurant and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, oil, sugar, vegetables, gas.

loans.name: Victory

texts.en: Victory owns a farm where she grows pumpkin and other vegetables. Victory works on her farm every day of the week. She is a very hard-working woman. Victory is 35 years old and married. She has 3 children. Victory is a LAPO client. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 ($1025) to purchase pumpkin seeds and insecticides to control pests on her farm. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase pumpkin seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza L., the 37-year-old mother of Nolie, aged four, and Noliza, aged two, is married to Nolie L., a farmer. They live in the village of Binarzang Quirino, Isabela where living conditions are average and peaceful, and the people dream not only of progress in their lives but also in the community.

Flordeliza manages a simple village store which offers most of the prime commodities needed by her fellow villagers. She would now like to expand into vegetable and meat vending, her reason for requesting this loan. She is working diligently to develop this additional source of income in order to supply the daily needs of her family and save for the education of her children. To further achieve their dreams, Flordeliza and her husband will double their time and efforts in their respective businesses.

loans.use: To add vegetables and meat to her store's inventory.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria E. es una señora trabajadora que se ha esforzado por tener su negocio propio, vende ropa y zapatos, negocio que inicio con ayudad de su esposo, el trabaja de albañil, la Sra. Maria tiene 50 años de edad, reside en Laureles norte en la ciudad de Managua, con seis hijos que están independiente con su propia familia. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir en inventario en la compra de ropa de dama y caballeros, zapatos con estilos variados, para elevar sus ventas, sus planes son establecer una tienda en su casa, ya que alquila un modulo en el mercado y se le hace muy cansado.
texts.en:
María E. is a woman who has worked hard to have her own business selling clothing and shoes. She began the business with the help of her husband, who works as a mason. María is 50 years old and lives in the North Laureles section of the city of Managua near her six children, all of whom are on their own and have families. The loan for which she has applied will go towards the purchase of inventory, men’s and women’s clothing, and shoes in various styles. In order to increase her sales, María plans to open a shop in her home rather than renting a stall in the marketplace, as that makes her too tired.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's and men's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Azer

texts.en: Azer lives in Khachmaz town. He is married. This man has been in his business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the necessary things for a beauty salon. He was born in 1979.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for beauty salon

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma S., 41 years of age, married with 3 children, is a resident of Upper Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a carpenter by profession. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs. When she heard about PMPC, she applied for membership and availed of the credit services of the cooperative for her capital in her vegetable vending business. In her 13th loan cycle she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 for additional capital to purchase various vegetables for sale. She hopes that her business will prosper in the future, so that it can augment their income to improve their way of living and send their children to school.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables and various groceries to be sold

loans.name: Alberto Rolando

texts.es: El sr. Rolando trabaja con la institución desde el año 2005, con un grupo solidario, actualmente trabaja con su crédito individual, tiene su microbus está inscrito en el sindicato Villa Victoria, tiene su esposa y sus hijos, en edad escolar, su esposa lo ayuda con los gastos de la casa, con algunos trabajos de macramé que realiza cuando tiene pedidos. Invertirá el crédito en la compra  de caja y corona para el microbus,  que en este momento está teniendo algunas fallas. El horario de trabajo es de 06:00 de la mañana hasta las 24:00 horas.
texts.en:
Mr. Rolando has worked with the institution since 2005, with a solidarity group, and currently works with an individual loan. His bus is registered with the Villa Victoria union. He has a wife and school age children. His wife helps with the household expenses, working on macrame projects when she has requests. He will invest this loan money in the purchase of a change box and parts for the bus, which is currently having some mechanical difficulties. He works from 6am until midnight.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for this vehicle

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Yorn K., sixty-three, and her husband, Mr. Phon Chen, sixty-four, live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1972 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. The eldest son is married and no longer lives at home. One daughter is a silk weaver, one child is a teacher and the other one attends school. 
 
Yorn has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband raises cows. She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Lilya

texts.ru: Лиля - женщина 47 лет , замужем, имеет четверых детей.Она купив свежую рыбу,каптит её и продаёт на рынке.Она уже много лет занимается этим бизнесом, у неё большой опыт в этой деятельности.Кредитуется она уже второй год.Для закупа рыбы, которую она хочет законсервировать на продажу.Она пунктуально , аккуратно работает с кредитами.
texts.en:
Lilya is a 47 year old woman; she is married and has four children. She purchases fresh fish, smokes it and sells it at the market. She has been in this business for many years; she has a lot of experience in this area. This is her second year as a borrower in order to purchase fish that she wants to preserve for sale. She works punctually and accurately with lenders.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of smoked fish

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Мухаё жительница Костакоза и бизнесмен ка, которая торгует детской одеждой на рынке этого города.Мухаё каждый свой кредит использует на расширение своего бизнеса.За товаром ездит поочерёдно в Бишкек и Истаравшан.Следующий кредит хочет использовать на завоз летнего товара детской одежды.За годы сотрудничества в Фондом у Мухаё улучшилось семейное положение благодаря развитию её бизнеса
texts.en:
Muchayo resides in Kostakoz. She makes a living by selling children's clothing at the local market. Muhayo uses each of her loans to expand her business. She buys goods in Bishkek and Istaravshan. She would like to use the next loan for the purchase of summer children’s clothing. Mohayo’s family situation has improved throughout the years of her cooperation with the microfinance bank thanks to the expansion of her business.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: children's clothing (summer season)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Rogelia Mercedes

texts.es:
ROGELIA MERCEDES C. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” vive en el distrito de Calleria, tiene 58 años de edad, 03 hijos mayores de edad y su esposo se dedica a la avicultura.

Inició el negocio de comidas por las tardes y noches, tales como juanes, tacacho y pescado asado. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, implemento con una parrilla e insumos para su negocio ya que vive en una zona bien concurrida y el negocio le ha salido muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá para construir un galpón de pollos y está realizando compras como listones, clavos, etc, el cuál servirá para criar pollos.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única identidad que da préstamos con bajos intereses y da facilidad de obtener un préstamo.
texts.en:
Rogelia Mercedes C. T. is a member of the "Mujeres Solidarias" (Women United) Village Bank. She lives in the District of Calleria. She is 58 and has 3 grown-up children. She and her husband earn their living as poultry farmers. Rogelia started an afternoon and evening business selling foods like juanes (chicken and rice wrapped in banana leaves), tacacho (crushed bananas in olive oil), and grilled fish. She used her first loan of 300 soles to get a grill and supplies for her business. She lives in a busy area so business has gone very well. Rogelia plans to use her loan of 2,000 soles to buy wood planks, nails, etc., to build a coop for raising her chickens. She says that Manuela Ramos is the only institution that offers low-interest rates and makes it easy to get a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wooden planks, nails and other materials to build a coop for her chickens.

loans.name: Theary

texts.en:
Mrs. Theary U., 29, and her husband, Mr. Veasna Loem, 32, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2006 and have one young daughter. Besides Theary’s daughter, Theary also has her old parents living with her.

Theary has been a tailor for three years. It’s a skill she learned from her husband who has been a tailor for six years as well. They rU. the business at their own house. Theary is requesting her first loan of $500 to build a shop and to purchase additional clothes for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To build a shop and to purchase additional clothes for her tailoring business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the Nyamhanga borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 37-year-old woman; she is married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are aged 20 and 18. She also cares for 2 other dependents.

Veronica started her own shop business selling bananas, coconuts, and potatoes 7 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Veronica’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more bananas, coconuts and potatoes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Veronica hopes to save money, expand her business, and pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, coconuts, and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina Asu F. is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitele K Fou.  She is married and has 12 adult  children.  To make a living, Selina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ice cream in the local community.  Selina has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

Selina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Selina is requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Selina from SPBD.  Selina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina, de 30 años, es una madre trabajadora muy abnegada por sus 4 hijos, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos. Ella es de una comunidad nativa (ashaninka) y a pesar de hablar castellano, también mantiene intacto su idioma, pero ha cambiado la pesca y caza de animales de campo por el cultivo de café y plátanos. Esta actividad la realiza en compañía de su esposo, lo cual le es muy placentero, ya que de ese modo se acompañan y se ayudan mutuamente. Para la comercialización, su esposo se encarga de llevar el café hasta una empresa acopiadora (la recolectora más importante de la ciudad) donde la pagan un buen precio por su producto, lo que le permite recuperar lo invertido. Mientras tanto, Adelina continúa con la recolección de los granos, ya que los meses de cosecha son claves para recaudar mayor cantidad de dinero para comprar los comestibles de la familia en grandes cantidades, para que los siguientes meses no tengan carencias alimenticias; aprovechando también para comprar vestimentas a sus hijos, lo cual la hace muy feliz. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual, por ello le tienen mucho aprecio todos los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cafetales y de ese modo asegure su próxima cosecha.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for her busuness

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia T. is from the village of T.. She is 60 years-old and married with three adult children. Lilia owns and operates a food stall selling fruit products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling fresh fruit in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Lilia joined Kiva partner PMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell particularly fresh fruit. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

The Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Maria Giva

texts.es: La señora Maria Gina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vendedoras D. Villa Universitaria”, Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Separad, tiene 45 años y 05 hijos, 01 que aun estudia y depenD. D. ella. Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios gracias a su carácter emprendedor, pudo iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. comidas prepararas.Maria Gina, venD. sus comidas en un local acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, por su buena sazón sus ventas le van muy bien,  los venD. durante el día.Con este préstamo D. S/ 800.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos D. arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios D. cocina para brindar un servicio D. calidad.  Maria Gina, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas D. comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.

loans.use: Comprará insumos.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46 years old, married, and the father of seven children. His firstborn has finished senior high school while the rest are still in school.

Charles is a very hardworking young man whose hard efforts contribute about 82% of his household income. He is a trader and, for twenty-one years, has traded in lace materials, shoes, slippers, textiles and dressing bags. He takes delivery of stock from Kumasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana and retails to the final consumers.

Charles requests the loan to augment his working capital to buy more stock of lace clothes, slippers and dressing bags to sell. He believes the loan will enable him to raise more income to support his children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothing materials, ladies bags and slippers

loans.name: Osiris Mileyda

texts.es: Osiris Mileyda tiene 32 años, es madre soltera. Rosa tiene 4 hijos y todos estudian. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella tenía muchas dificultades y decido sacar a sus hijos y su familia adelante, y decide realizar la compra de muy pocos productos, debido a que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para sustentar a su hogar, por lo que salía a recorrer las calles ofreciendo los dulces, lamentablemente algunas veces no lograba vender mucho, pero no se dio por vencida y además de salir a vender por las calles también ofrecía sus productos a sus vecinos. Y es por este motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de bombones, paletas, chicles, caramelos y chocolates  y así generar un poco de ingresos. Osiris tiene le deseo de establecer la venta de ropa en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Osiris Mileyda, 32, is a single mother of four, school age, children. She has sold sweets and has been involved in this humble activity for the past 9 years. She had many difficulties and decided to try to see her children get ahead so she decided to buy a very limited number of products because her income was not sufficient to sustain her home. She would go out into the streets offering her sweets. Regretably, sometimes she managed to sell very little but she did not let this defeat her. Besides selling in the streets she also offered her products to her neighbors. For this reason, she is requesting financing to buy candies, lollipops, chewing gum, caramels, chocolates to generate income. Osiris wishes to set up clothing sales in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Adonis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Adonis Antonio B. G. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Managua, desempeñándose como entrenador de deporte de basketball. Tiene dos años de ser cliente de CEPRODEL en los que ha obtenido 2 créditos, los cuales los ha pagado muy bien.

El señor B. ha utilizado sus préstamos para mejorar su vivienda el primero y el segundo para cubrir los gastos de promoción de su hijo y compra de materiales de construcción como Zinc, Perlin para mejorar parte de la cocina de su casa, la que estaba en mal estado. Es un padre de familia de tres niños menores de edad en edad escolar y casado.
texts.en:
Mr. Adonis B. works for the mayor's office in Managua as a basketball trainer. He has been a client of CEPRODEL for two years, during which time he has obtained two loans and paid them back promptly.

Mr. B. has used his loans to improve his house. With the first and second loans he covered the costs of school promotion for his child and to buy construction materials such as galvanized roofing and rafters to improve part of the kitchen, which was in bad condition.

He is married and the father of 3 school-age children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COSTS OF SCHOOL PROMOTION FOR HIS SON

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth is 40 years old and is married, with six children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. Her husband is a carpenter. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She sells foodstuffs like plantain, yam, garri and rice at retail prices. She hopes to be a major foodstuff distributor in the future. Janeth is a very hard working woman and she loves her business and family so much. With the profits she makes from her sales, she supports her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She is requesting for a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Lizzy

texts.en: Lizzy sells cooking oil (palm oil) and her husband is a retired civil servant. She is 50 years old and a mother of four. Her children are in school. Lizzy lives in Lagos State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2004. In order to increase the size of her business, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more palm oil to sell at retail prices. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. With the business, she will be able to take care of her children. She thanks all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more oil to sell

loans.name: Vũ's Group

texts.en: Kỷ Vũ V. is a 50-year-old man living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Kỷ is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Giữa 1 - Nhóm 03 (3). Kỷ is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Kỷ operates a store, selling animal feed and farm-related products in the local community. Kỷ has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities. In 2008, Kỷ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kỷ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. He is now requesting a new loan of 7.392.000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. Kỷ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Phan Thị Lý is a 45-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. 2. Nguyễn Thị Cừ is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.704.000 VND loan to support her business of providing recycling services. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. 4. Tô Thị L. is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 7.392.000 VND loan to support her business of operating a specialized retail store. 5. Dương Thị T. is a 58-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business of operating a specialized retail store. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Kỷ Vũ V. (20213040001) là 50 tuổi nam. Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Kỷ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Giữa 1 - Nhóm 03 (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm thức ăn gia súc & có liên quan đến nông trại trong cộng đồng địa phương. Kỷ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Kỷ kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, Kỷ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Kỷ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Phan Thị Lý (20213040005) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. Nguyễn Thị Cừ (20213040003) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.704.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. (20213040010) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Tô Thị L. (20213040004) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. 5. Dương Thị T. (20213040007) là 58 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phidelis

texts.en:
Phidelis Wambane is a retail shop owner in Nambale town, Busia district. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She is also a former nurse who opted to go into business. Her retail shop buys stock for sale three times a week from truck that deliver goods at Nambale.

Phidelis is very passionate about business and already she is thinking of venturing into the poultry farming business. She would like a loan of Kshs. 10,000 which will kick start her poultry. Part of the money would go to expanding the retail store stock. In the future, Phidelis would like to start a tailoring business.

loans.use: Venture into Poultry Farming.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie B. is 29 years old and a resident of P4 Silangit, Tangub City. She is married, and they are blessed with three school-age children. Analie's husband, Noel, is a painter, earning an average of not less than 5000 PHP per month. They were experiencing a financial crisis, and, to help her husband, she decided to engage in a sari-sari store (general store) business. For eight years she has sustained this business activity. She is now earning an average net income of not less than 3000 PHP per month. She says this amount is so helpful for their family income.

As a member of PMPC, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to add capital to her existing sari-sari store business. She is hoping that someday all her children will finish their studies and will find good jobs.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To add capital to her sari-sari store business

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 26 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil in southern Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Sahar has owned a hair salon for almost three years now. She also does makeup, hair removal, and sells beauty products. She is successful in her industry because she knows how to treat her customers well; her clients feel comfortable going to her salon since not only does she offer a wide variety of services, but more importantly, she is good at her work and is always aware of the newest hair styles and fashions.

When Sahar first started her business, she didn’t have trouble attracting clients because she already had faithful customers from her previous job. She decided to start her own business because she wanted to be independent. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and other people from her region. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for her salon. This is the first time that Sahar has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria  Y. is 63 and widowed with 1 child.  She owns a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Maria  has many years of experience in this business.  Maria  needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 750 talas or US $313 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Maria  joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Maria 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Maria Y. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amin Agha Shir Ali Group

texts.en:
Shir Ali is the group leader of Amin Agha Shir Ali group. He lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is a very responsible man. He has a general store where all kinds of goods are available.

He needs the loan to complete his inventory and to purchase more beverages, food and sanitary products. He would like to expand his business and to be a wonderful business dealer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goods to complete his inventory

loans.name: Julio Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio esta casado, La actividad del cliente es el servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi y minibus, actividad que desarrolla todos los dias, esta actividad se constituye en la principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia, que esta compuesta por sus cuatro hijos y su esposa quien tambien ayuda con los gastos del hogar con la venta de comida en un mercado populoso de nuestra ciudad.
El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo, reparacion de caja, con la compra de prensa y disco de embriague y otras reparaciones menores, para asi de esta manera tener su auto en optimas condiciones para desarrollar su trabajo. Es una persona responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Julio is married and provides passenger transport services by radio taxi and minibus. He works every day to develop his business, which is the main source of income for him and his family. His wife also helps with the household expenses by selling food at one of the crowded markets in the city. They have four children.

This loan will be used for vehicle repairs, specifically for replacement of the gearbox. He will also buy a clutch pedal and disc, as well as pay for other minor repairs. These fixes will allow him to keep his vehicle in optimal condition so that he can continue working. Julio is a responsible and hardworking person. He is extremely grateful to both Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es:
Santiago Felipe V. C.  tiene 60 años, es casado,  tiene  4 hijos que se llaman Freddy de 30, Javier de 28, Hilda de 35 y Miguel de 40 años,  Viven en el recinto San Francisco de Rumí pamba a una distancia de hora y media del Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural “San Francisco de Rumí pamba”.  La misma que esta conformada por 25 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y pastoreo de ganado bovino.

Santiago trabaja en la agricultura toda su vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de los  cultivos que más sobresalen en la zona son las papas, maíz, arbeja, habas, trigo y pastoreo de ganado.   Vende los productos cada cosecha en la ciudad de San Miguel. 

Santiago solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abonos orgánicos para la siembra de maíz.  Su meta es de mejoras sus cultivos y su forma de vida.   Los desafíos que enfrentan son falta de ayuda al agricultor, pocos ingresos económicos. Santiago manifiesta que en sus tiempos libres le gusta cantar junto al rió.
texts.en:
Santiago Felipe V. C., 60, is married and has four children whose names are: Freddy, 30, Javier, 28, Hilda, 35, and Miguel 40. They live in San Francisco de Rumí Pamba which is an hour and a half from San Miguel canton, Bolívar province. He is a member of the “San Francisco de Rumí Pamba” communal bank which has 25 members in total most of whom are in agriculture and sheep-raising. Santiago has worked in agriculture his whole life; it is his family’s main source of income. Among his crops are: potato, corn, pea, broad bean, wheat and cattle pasturage. He sells each harvest’s product in San Miguel. Santiago is asking for funds to buy fertilizers and organic manure for his corn crops. His goal is to improve his crops and his way of life. The challenges he faces are the lack of support for farmers and low income. Santiago tells us that he enjoys singing beside the river in his free time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and organic manure for his corn crops.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia C. is from the town of Banga. She is 46 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. She is described as kind and helpful. Amalia is involved in farming and hog-raising. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest at the market. She also grows pigs for fattening. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years already.

Amalia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amalia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She will also purchase feed for her pigs. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Amalia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees her children and supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Judith F.

texts.en:
Judith F. M. is a small-business woman. She runs a shop selling a variety of both soft and alcoholic drinks to customers at Yombo Lumo ward in Dar es Salaam.

Judith purchases her business goods from the wholesale suppliers and retail shops. She has been in her business for four years. The business income helps her to meet her daily family needs and provide for business expansion.

Judith wants to expand her business by injecting more capital into it as her business income increases. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to top up her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra.  María Teresa M. D., es una persona emprendedora quien tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación cuenta con dos molinos, además de las venta de leña, tortilla y frutas, ella trabaja de 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, cuenta con una trabajadora quien se encarga en la atención de los clientes (su hija).
Es madre de familia casada con tres hijos estos ya no se encuentra en el colegio ya que dos están casados y una soltera.
El préstamo solicitado es para utilizarlo en la compra de un motor para uno de los molinos, compra de leña y frutas para el negocio.
María Teresa  dice que todos los préstamos que le ha otorgado ceprodel han sido para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María Teresa M. D. is an enterprising individual who has a business in her home. She operates two grain mills and also sells firewood, tortillas, and fruit. María works from 5am until 6pm. She has one employee (her daughter) who is in charge of attending to the customers.

María is married and the mother of three children who are no longer in school. Two are married and the other one is single.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a motor for one of her grain mills. She will also buy firewood and fruit for her business. María Teresa says that all the loans she has received from CEPRODEL have been used for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, fruit, and a motor for her grain mill

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Repair parts

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta K. is from the village of Tabuk-Tulay, Dicayas. She is 49 years old. Modesta is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Modesta owns & operates a tailoring business providing general alterations & tailoring services to local community members. Modesta has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Modesta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Modesta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. Modesta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Modesta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Engelina

texts.en:
Engelina T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Engelina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Engelina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling broiler and native chickens in the local community. Engelina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Engelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Engelina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional chickens to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Engelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens to sell

loans.name: Sam-Oeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-oeun C. is 27 years old and her husband, Mr. Sarom Rorn, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2004 and have two young children, a son and a daughter. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Sam-oeun has been a silk weaver for twelve years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then sells them in a Phnom Penh market. Sam-oeun is asking for a loan of $400 US to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy silk material for her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of liquor to sell

loans.name: Jonás De Jesús

texts.es: El Sr. Jonás de Jesús H. M. él es trabajador activo de la Alcaldía municipal San Rafael del Sur   él  se desempeña  Asistente de servicios municipales, tiene  dos años de trabajar para esta institución. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación, estos  créditos con la institución le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de no existir estos tipos de servicio no hubiese  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Jonás de Jesús works in the borough hall of San Rafael del Sur, where he is a municipal services assistant. He has worked there for two years. He has had two loans with CEPRODEL (Center for Promotion of Local Development and Poverty Eradication), which he used to buy construction materials for improving his house. He has benefitted greatly from loans with this institution. Without these loans, his family’s standard of living would not have improved.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials: sand, cement, stones

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen P. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 51 years old. Ellen is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for this activity.

In 2009, Ellen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Ellen is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Brigido

texts.en:
Brigido S. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 56 years old and married with two children. To make a living, Brigido owns and operates a general store. His main source of income comes from his retail business selling a variety of products in the local community. Brigido works hard to maintain his store.

Brigido joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Brigido is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Brigido from CEVI. He plans to save the additional revenue generated from his business to use as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to invest in business expansion

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es: Zoraida, de 21 años, es una mujer fuerte, que, junto a su esposo Teófilo, de 31 años, cuidan a su hijo Linconl, de 3 años, en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Casacoto. Ahí, todas las mañanas se hace cargo de sus cultivos de papa y arveja, que hace 7 años, adquirió su esposo Teófilo; pero gracias a la buena administración de ella, pudo alquilar un nuevo terreno agrícola, donde siembra más cantidad de hortalizas, ya que según menciona, son los que mayor demanda tienen. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder compartir un momento con su familia; ya que su esposo, trabaja como chofer trasportando varios sacos de producción a otros lugares del país, donde aprovecha, y lleva a vender las cosechas de Zoraida. Que gracias a su buen cuidado son muy bien pagadas. Eso la incentiva y en el futuro, desea adquirir más terrenos agrícolas, donde piensa sembrar en mayor cantidad. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y, está  feliz de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque sus integrantes son personas solidarias y trabajadoras. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá adquirir 60 sacos de abono, para sembrar papa de la variedad “única” y “canchay”.
texts.en:
Zoraida, 21, is a strong woman.  Together with her husband, Teófilo, 32, she cares for her their 3 year-old son, Linconl. They live in a rented house in the locality of Casacoto. There, every morning, she is in charge of her potato and pea crops, which she took over from her husband 7 years ago. Thanks to her good management, she has since been able to rent a new plot of farmland where she plants more vegetables, particularly those most in demand.

Her favorite thing is to be able to share something with her family. Her husband works as a driver, transporting various amounts of products to other parts of the country, where he takes advantage and also sells what Zoraida harvests. Thanks to her good care, they are well paid. This encourages her and in the future, she hopes to acquire more farmland so that she can plant more.

This is her third loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to work with her communal bank because its members are group-minded and hard-working. She will be able to buy 60 sacks of fertilizer with this loan, which she will use to plant potatoes of the "única" and "canchay" varieties.

loans.use: to buy 60 sacks of fertilizer for planting potatoes

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Felipa is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Felipa owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making & selling snacks & other delicacies like rice and cassava cakes in the local community. Felipa has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felipa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Felipa is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Felipa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital

loans.name: Stephen Ouna

texts.en:
Stephen Ouna O. is 27 years old and married to Lillian who sells vegetables and fruits. They live next to Kibuye market. 

Stephen is a carpenter and has been in this business for three years. He is applying for his second loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced to us by a friend who is also a client here. He intends to use the money to buy timber for making chairs, foam materials and buy materials for sofa sets (couches). Stephen makes an income of Kes 10,000 per month.

His desire is to have a big workshop in town and supply furniture on wholesale. Stephen also desires to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: Buy timber  to make chairs, foam for sofa sets

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen P. is from the village of Brgy. Paungan,Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Helen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 17000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 39 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
The married mother of a 12-year-old son named Mikhailo, Nadiya runs a clothing sales business in her home town of Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. In the trade for 17 years, Nadiya sells women’s clothing in one of the locals malls called ‘Malva Plus’. She launched this venture right after she finished school, and her business has grown considerably since then. Presently, she has one employee working for her.

Nadiya’s business is the main source of income for her and her family. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted seasonal merchandise, i.e. women’s warm winter pants. She is hoping to continue expanding her business and open a new vending location in the near future. One of her personal goals is to give her son a chance to get a good college education.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane Koné est un célibataire de 26 ans, qui vit chez son père à Bougouni dans le quartier Heremakono-Nord.
Monsieur  Souleymane Koné a vite abandonné l’école moderne pour mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Il a tenté plusieurs activités sans réussite, notamment la vente de tissus.
C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’apprendre la vente des mèches, pommades, crème parfums, déodorants etc... Il a appris cette activité auprès de sa sœur.
Avec une expérience de 5 ans, monsieur Souleymane Koné maîtrise son activité.
Pour agrandir son entreprise, il décida de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, des mèches, pommades, crèmes, vernis parfums et... en grande quantité à Bamako,(capitale de la république du Mali).
Ses clients sont généralement les femmes.  Il est à sa première  expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt, monsieur Souleymane Koné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000 FCFA.
 Dans les années à venir il envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane Kone is a 26-year old single man who lives with his father in Bougouni, in the quarter of Heremakono-Nord.

Mr. Souleymane Kone left school at an early age to start up revenue generating activities. He attempted various businesses without success, including the sale of fabrics. It was then that he decided to take up the sale of hair treatments, skin creams, perfumes, deodorants etc. He learned the business from his sister. 

With a 5-year experience Mr. Souleymane Kone has truly mastered the business. 

In order to expand his business, he decided to access a loan through Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field  Partner) with the goal of purchasing hair treatments, skin creams, nail polish, perfumes etc, in  large quantities in Bamako (capital city of the Republic of Mali). 

His clients are primarily women. It is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan Mr. Souleymane Kone expects to earn a monthly income of 20 000 FCFA. In the years to come he expects to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas E. is a married woman with two children who go to the local school. She sells a variety of Khmer cakes and desserts in one small kiosk in her village in Kompong Tom province. She has other financial support from her husband, who is a window and bed maker.  This family can earn around $4.6 per day to ensure their family a comfortable life. Recently, her husband ran out of raw materials from his stock supply. This has caused frequent interruptions to his operations. Therefore, Meas E. would like a loan to be used for her husband to buy wood to make beds to sell.

loans.use: To buy wood for her husband to make beds to sell.

loans.name: Jereza

texts.en:
Jereza is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a food vending business. She lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000.  Jereza is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can purchase raw materials. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jereza aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more assorted items for her shop

loans.name: Rigail Ramiro

texts.es:
Rigail Ramiro M. C. tiene 26 años, es casado vive con la esposa  y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.   Tiene 1 hijo.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada EN EL RECINTO Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas en ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Pigail se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial Murillo y los vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa para la familia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Rigail Ramiro M. C. is 26 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and child in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

The Nueva Unión community bank is located in Guamayacu, in Echeandia canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Rigail is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products at Comercial Murillo and sells them there as well.  He is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  Rigail faces challenges in his business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house for his family.

Rigail enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Đoàn

texts.en:
B. Đoàn Thị lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - B. Ninh. She is married, has two school-aged children and makes a living by selling wood products to local businesses and people who live in her community. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 4,000,000 VND a month from her work.

In 2009, B. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business.  She has successfully repaid two previous loans and has applied for a third, for 7,392,000 VND, to buy additional supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and northern Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


B. Đoàn Thị (20203050017) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, B. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.
