After 10 years in this activity, she finds attending to so many people at the same time the most difficult task. Many times she and her helpers cannot cope with all the work. In the future she plans to improve her facility thus being able to provide her customers with better service. This is her first loan with MFP. She know that she has to pay all the installments on time if she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank, where she has been very well received. She will use the thousand New Soles that she is requesting to buy the ingredients for the dishes that she prepares and sells in her coffee shop, this way she will begin to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine Cissé est une femme de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PAR-C. depuis 2 ans et a 4 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et parallèlement elle vend des denrées alimentaires telles que du riz, du sucre, de l'huile etc. Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes et de contribuer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yacine Cissé is a 35-year old woman who is married with five children. She has been a member of the village bank in PAR-C. for two years and has had four loans. She fattens beef and at the same time sells foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, oil etc. Her aim is to boost her savings and help to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Everlyne Baraza

texts.en:
Everlyne Baraza A. is a 37 year old woman who is married and is the mother of six children. She is a farmer in Nambale, Busia district.

Before she ventured into farming as a business, Everlyne was solely a housewife, she says. She started farming so as to be part of the breadwinning team in her family.

Everlyne would like a loan of KES 10,000 that will go to expanding her farm business.

loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en: Merlina T. is from the village of Purok 4, Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Merlina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en:
Suzanne D. is a 40 year old widow from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has seven children.

Madame D. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 12 years and always paid back her loans on time. She has a small shop where she sells a variety of goods. This loan will allow her to equip her retail shop with new products.

loans.use: For the purchase of various products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Jose A., her business partner, they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own eatery for quite some time now.

Evelyn has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her eatery.     

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 35,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business so she can buy the raw ingredients needed to continue production of her recipes.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide her children with a good, comfortable and well-off future.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients needed to continue production of her recipes.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M., 43, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Danilo M., a driver, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own preschool and canteen for quite some time now.

Marites has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the success of her business, Marites would like to apply for a PHP 28,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying equipment needed for the school and groceries for her canteen.

Marites dreams that many more students will be studying in her school this coming school year.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy equipment needed for the school and groceries for her canteen

loans.name: Madres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
L. Sra. Violeta  tiene 37 años es casada  tiene un hijo pequeño D. 4 años su esposo trabaja en una imprenta   durante algún tiempo elL. lo ayudo laborando en el mismo lugar con sus ahorros ambos lograron comprar una combi para hacerL. trabajar como transporte publico. En L. actualidad  Violeta administra L. combi y en algunas oportunidades también trabaja  como cobradora D. manera que sus  ganancias  son mayores,  por ahora esta invirtiendo en L. reparación del carro,  el dinero del préstamo  otorgado por “ADAPROSPO” lo utilizara para pasar L. revisión técnica   requisito indispensable para que su unidad continúe trabajando. Violeta también estudio cosmetología  y es a lo que se dedicara en el futuro  tiene pensado poner un salón D. belleza  en su casa,  es para eso que ahorra  por que quiere tener un  salón D. belleza  moderno con todas las comodidades para ofrecer a su futura clienteL.,  elL. es parte del grupo “MADRES EMPRENDEDORAS” conformado por 12 socias vecinas del mismo lugar, tiene el cargo D. tesorera el cual cumple con mucha responsabilidad.

* violeta es L. que aparece en L. foto con polo turqueza
texts.en:
Sra. Violeta is 37 years old, married, and has a four year old son. She works at a print shop and her husband works at the same place on a part-time basis. Using their savings, they were able to purchase a van to use as a public transportation vehicle. Violeta currently manages the van’s usage and also is in charge of collecting payments, which are being invested in repairs at the moment.

The loan provided by EDAPROSPO will be used to pay for a full technical inspection of the vehicle so that she can continue to put it to work. Violeta also studies cosmetology and plans to open a beauty salon in her house in the future. She continues to save so that she will be able to have a modern beauty salon that has all the conveniences to offer to her future clients.

Violeta is part of the group “Madres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Mothers), which consists of twelve members who live in the same area. In her position as the Communal Bank treasurer, she carries a great amount of responsibility.

*Violeta is the woman in the photograph wearing a turquoise shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a vehicle inspection

loans.name: Verly

texts.en:
Verly L., 31, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Danilo L., a messenger for a prominent bank, they are blessed with two children. To help her husband earn so that their family can have a better life, Verly has been managing her own ready-to-wear clothing stall for quite some time now.

A regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, Verly regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow ten times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money to expand and improve her clothing business.

To ensure the continued success of her business, she is now requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 loan to buy more products to replenish her stocks and maintain the operations of her variety store. Verly dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to replenish stocks and maintain operations of her variety store

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia C. is from the village of Owaon. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cynthia raises crops, mostly vegetables. Cynthia has been in business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Cynthia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions. 

------------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: María Rosalina

texts.es:
María Rosalina tiene 24 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos dependientes, vive junto a su familia en el anexo El Cuarenta del caserío Lagunas, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales. Ella cría cerdos, pollos, cabritos y cuyes en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Cuando estos animales ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los vende quincenalmente en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo). Esta es una actividad de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia. Su esposo es pescador.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y lograr que estos se desarrollen de mejor manera para percibir mayores ganancias al momento de venderlos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar la construcción de su vivienda para obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la imagen nos muestra uno de los animales que venderá pronto.
texts.en:
María Rosalina is 24 and has 2 dependent children. She lives with her family in the El Cuarenta annex of the Lagunas village, a rural area in the district of Morrope, which is known for having the majority of its population concentrated in rural areas with a great distance between them. It belongs to the Lambayeque province located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For five years she has raised and sold animals. She raises hogs, chickens, swine and guinea pigs in pens outside of her home. When these animals have reached a good level of development she sells them every fortnight in the Moshoqueque market (the wholesale market of Chiclayo City). This is an activity that helps her family greatly. Her husband is a fisherman. Maria wants to purchase balanced food to improve her animals' nutrition and help them to develop in a better manner to bring her better income when she sells them. For this reason she has requested her first loan of 1000 soles with Epydme Alternativa, which will help her to achieve this goal. She is a hard-working and very responsible woman. Her greatest wish is to improve her home's construction to obtain a better quality of life. In the photo she is showing us one of the animals that she will sell soon.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Balanced food for improved animal nurtition

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur S. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 3 to 19 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house. His eldest daughter is a student in Germany, while the younger two children are in high school and kindergarten. 

Enhtur operates a car repair and service business. He purchases old cars in order to sell them which produces a good profit. He began his business in 2005, and since that time has been enlarging his business to include operating a car repair service. 

This couple works hard to provide for their children and improve the quality of their lives with education. He is a modest and hard working person and requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase construction materials and supplies for building a new dormitory to expand his business lines.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and supplies for building a new dormitory.

loans.name: Subhadra

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Subhadra K..  She is married and has six children aged 17, 20, 23, 24, 26 and 28.  In 2010, she established her farming business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  

She used her most recent loan from BPW to purchase seeds for vegetables and food for cattle.  In the future, Subhadra plans to grow her farming business and livestock.  She thanks you for your support. She hopes to get a larger loan. 

Over 70 percent of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (tarkari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. 

 For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: purchase seeds for vegetables and food for cattle

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan C. lives in the village of Jang in Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old, single and makes a living by running a shop where she sells a variety of foods which are popular in her area. She has been in this line of work for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 4,000 PHP, to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta M., from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City, is 53 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Ernesta owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of meals to customers in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ernesta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant, Ernesta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for her restaurant

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. is from the village of Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Norma runs a general store, earning her income by selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Norma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory, to serve as working capital and to repair her store. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, serve as working capital and repair her store

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La señora Maria Nela de 36 años, tiene 4 hijos. Se dedica al negocio de una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes y  sopas este negocio lo inicio su madre por iniciativa propia desde hace 2 años y que hoy día administra Maria desde las 6 de la mañana a 9 de la noche, las ventas son regulares por lo que desea invertir más para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella está solicitando un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de Arroz,  frijol, aceite y otros productos que necesita en su negocio. Los sueños de ella son mantener un negocio estable por muchos años, desarrollarse dentro del mercado y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Nela, 36, has 4 children. She operates a small corner store where she sells basic commodities, sweets, household products, etc. Her mother started the business 2 years ago and Maria manages it from 6 in the morning to 9 at night. Business has been steady and Maria wants to invest in a wider range of the good for her customers. She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy rice, beans, cooking oil and other products that she needs for the business. What she most wants is to hold on to the business and improve it so that she can, in turn, help improve the lives of her family

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Francisco Ever

texts.es: Francisco Ever F. D. de 25 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa. Francisco se dedica a la pesca y venta de camarones, los cuales obtiene a diario de la Bahía de Jiquilisco, un lugar de mucho turismo y en donde se vende en grandes cantidades el marisco ya que su precio es más bajo, razón por la que muchos propietarios de restaurantes o ventas de mariscos, llegan a este lugar. La esposa de Francisco le ayuda a la comercialización de estos, convirtiendo su negocio en la única fuente de ingresos con la que ambos cuentan. Francisco solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar hieleras para colocar los camarones, como también hielo y algunas redes nuevas para pescar. Francisco desea seguir adelante con su negocio y de esta manera contar con un mejor futuro junto a su esposa.
texts.en:
Francisco Ever F. D. is 25 years old and lives with his wife in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Usulután. He works catching shrimp and then selling them. He gets the shrimp daily from the Jiquilisco Bay, a place with a lot of tourism and and where large quantities of seafood are sold because of the low prices. This is why many restaurant owners or seafood merchants go to this area. Francisco’s wife helps him with sales, making his business the only source of income that they have.

Francisco is requesting a loan so that he can purchase ice coolers for his shrimp, as well as ice and some new shrimp nets. Francisco wants to continue growing with his business so that he and his wife can have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase ice coolers, ice, and new nets for catching shrimp.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en: Chuluunbaatar D. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters, aged 16 and 18, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local high school and Chuluunbaatar operates a used clothing and shoes retail business with the help of his wife. He has been engaged in this business since 2007 and has gained much experience since then. In the future, he hopes to expand his business by selling more and different kinds of used items through his stall. Chuluunbaatar is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more quality used clothing and shoes in order to increase his product lines.

loans.use: To purchase more quality used clothing

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es: El señor José Omar K. F. se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas hace mas de un año aproximadamente , su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio Fonavi San Martín Ica en el cual vive con su esposa y su menor hijo también con sus padres con los cuales comparte los gastos familiares.El Solicitante presenta experiencia acrediticia con el cual se compró una moto líneal , está solicitando el crédito para ampliar su negocio comprando mercadería para campaña navideña se le otorgará el crédito por que tiene buenas referencias y tiene capacidad para asumir una nueva obligación.
texts.en: Jose Omar K. F. has had a business selling drinks and candy for more than a year.  His business is located in his home in the San Martin housing development in Ica, where he lives with his wife, their minor child and his parents, with whom they share the family expenses.  Jose has taken a prior loan, which he used to buy a motorcycle.  He is requesting this loan to expand his business by buying merchandise for the Christmas season.  He will be granted this loan because he has good references and has the capacity to assume a new obligation.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy D. is a married woman who lives in Purok Banagan, Barangay Tomongtong, EB Magalona, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: crab netting (panggalan) and a fishing business. Her husband Amor, who is 32 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 1 and 12 years old. Amy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Amy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 8th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to buy a new engine for her fishing boat so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. Amy D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for crab cage

loans.name: Launh

texts.en: Launh S. is a 45-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. Launh S. has a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as cabbages and cucumbers, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband is a fisherman. The couple has four school-aged children. Currently, Launh S. is concerned that she faces difficulties in traveling anywhere. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Launh S. has requested a loan to be used to buy a second motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a second motorcycle to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a specialized retail store in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over four months and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2003, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Joy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Joy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to run her retail store

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang S., 28, raises pigs, earning an income of $4 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of $5 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $40 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of  $1,000 to repair her husband’s car to operate his business more efficiently. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Her husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To repair her husband's car to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Risa Ole

texts.en:
Risa Ole M. is 24 years old. He is married to Melua M. and blessed with four children. Risa has been farming for the last three years. He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. 

Risa hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to become a large scale farmer, to buy a bigger piece of land and to build a permanent home. Risa is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and wood.

loans.name: Armogast

texts.en:
Armogast is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

He has operated a fuel selling business for the past one year, selling from home to motorcycle operators. Armogast faces a major challenge of high prices of fuel which reduces the number of clients. He hopes to establish a fuel station for selling fuel. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase fuel for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Isatu. She is married and has two children aged thirteen and seven, plus one additional dependent who lives with her because she is her younger sister. In 2006, Isatu established a plastic bowl business. She began her business because she wanted to be independent. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,162,200 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy more business stock. Isatu hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately  230,000 SLL. In the future, she plans to build a house and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls for her business

loans.name: Patricia Alexandra

texts.es:
Patricia de 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora  que inicio hace 6 años en un puesto pequeño  le gusta conversar con la gente y promocionar su producto.

Ella sale a su local en la bahía 6 días a la semana. Un día se la dedica a su hogar con su familia. Algunas veces sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio cuando están de vacaciones.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar prenda de vestir para el mejoramiento de su negocio , lo que más desea  es tener una casa más cómoda para ella y su familia y tener su negocio mas surtido para tener mas ventas y poder darles lo mejor  a sus hijos en lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Patricia, age 32, is a hardworking woman who started a small clothing stand six years ago. She enjoys talking with people and promoting her products.

Patricia sells from her shop in La Bahía six days a week. One day is set aside so that she can be at home with her family. Sometimes her children will help with the business whenever they are on vacation.

With this loan, Patricia will buy clothing to improve her business. What she wants most is to have a more comfortable home for her and her family as well as a well-stocked business to help her generate more sales and give her children what they need to have a better life.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group
loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Doña Martha, de 54 años de edad , es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo  municipio de Estelí ,ella es madre de dos hijos , esta casada, se dedica a vender productos alimenticios en una pequeña pulpería que ella misma administra, esta pulpería la tiene en su hogar , lleva 7 años en esta actividad. Ella empezó su negocio con poco capital sin la ayuda de nada con el tiempo ha venido mejorando y creciendo su negocio, ella tiene expectativas de gran crecimiento de su negocio, sus hijos la apoyan, el mayor de sus hijos trabaja en Costa Rica el le envía remesas para que se ayude con los gastos del hogar. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar más productos para vender en su pulpería, incrementar su inventario. Con esto espera mejorar sus ventas, mantener surtida de todo tipo de productos que la gente demande, incrementar su clientela, mejorar sus ingresos.  
Desea convertir su pulpería en un mini súper mercado, componer su casa es una de sus próximas metas  e incorporarle a su negocio venta de ropa. Pues ella se considera una mujer con un gran espíritu de superación.
texts.en: Ms. Martha, 54, is originally from Pueblo Nuevo in the municipality of Estelí. She is married, the mother of two children, and sells food products in a small pulpería [grocery store] that she runs herself. She has this pulpería in her house and has been running it for seven years. She started her business with very little capital and without any help. Over time, she has been improving and growing her business. She expects great growth for her business. Both of her children support her. Her oldest son works in Costa Rica and sends remittances to help her with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more products to sell in her pulpería and to increase her inventory. She hopes that this will allow her to improve her sales, keep the store stocked with all types of products that people demand, increase her clientele, and improve her earnings. She would like to convert her pulpería to a mini supermarket. One of her next goals is to repair her house, as well as to incorporate clothing sales into her business. She considers herself to be a woman with a great desire to improve.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her small grocery store and to increase her inventory

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred K. is a 37-year-old single lady who is the mother of two children. She runs a grocery stall at Zambezi market in Limuru town. 

This is her primary business, which she has been doing for the last four years.

This is her fourth loan from KADET Ltd., and she intends to use it to pay school fees for her children. 

Winfred hopes to educate her children and to grow her business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Tuzigame Group

texts.fr:
Pascaline est une commerçante âgée de 34ans qui habite au chef lieu de la Province de Kayanza située au Nord du Burundi. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme la farine de maïs mais aussi vend des habits et autres articles depuis 6 ans et elle est en même temps cultivatrice. Elle est mariée a Ernest Nduwayo lui-même commerçant d’habits et ont 6 enfants âgés respectivement de 14ans, 12ans, 10ans,7ans,5ans et 1an 6mois qui étudient. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital et agrandir son activité pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère que son business va croitre considérablement pour lui permettre d’assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux 
 
Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Tuzigame».
texts.en: Pascaline is a 34-year-old shopkeeper who lives at the chief place in the province of Kayanza, situated to the north of Burundi.  She has sold not only food products, such as corn flour, but also clothes and other articles for 6 years and at the same time, works as a cultivator.  She is married to Ernest Nduwayo, himself a clothing shopkeeper, and they have 6 children, aged respectively 14 years old, 12 years old, 10 years old, 7 years old, 1 year old, and 6 months old, who are being educated.  She studied until her 6th year of primary school.  She is asking Kiva for a loan to augment her capital and increase the size of her business in order to make large profits.  She hopes her business will grow considerably in order to allow her to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.  She is a member of the group "Tuzigame."

loans.use: to augment his capital and to increase his business in order to make large profits.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 45 años, casado y padre de dos hijos en las edades de 11 y 12 años,  es un habitante de   San Jacinto, municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde es muy conocido por ser  un buen ciudadano y comercializar carne mediante un expendio o punto de ventas donde le compran a través de unidades de peso como onzas, libras, kilos de acuerdo a las necesidades y posibilidades de sus clientes.  Esta experiencia es tradicional para Carlos, porque él la aprendió de su padre y en la actualidad es su propio negocio, el que le permite un ingreso  suficiente para el sostenimiento de su familia y por eso quiere hacerlo crecer,  pues  planea mayor bienestar para sus hijos que en la actualidad están pequeños y son estudiantes. Carlos vende de contado y también a crédito, el tiene además de sus herramientas como peso cuchillo hacha, mesas, un congelador  con muy buena capacidad de almacenamiento que necesita aprovechar más efectivamente.  Su meta más adelante es modernizar su carnicería con maquinarias especiales en un local bien acondicionado  y contiguo a su vivienda;  su mayor desafío ocurre esporádicamente, cuando en el pueblo suspenden el fluido eléctrico por mantenimiento o reparación del sistema eléctrico y   debe acudir a la vieja técnica de salar la carne y promocionarla, teniendo como base  la preparación de deliciosos sancochos trifásicos, que incluyen tres tipos de carnes saladas. Mientras Carlos trabaja generando una rentabilidad sobre la venta no menor del 17%, continua esforzándose por aumentar su capital de trabajo mediante financiamiento, propósito por el cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a su primer financiamiento; con su credikiva comprará carne en mayor volumen, para aumentar su clientela y ofrecer un producto que comprado en mayor volumen,  le permite un buen descuento que traslada a sus clientes, con tal de conservarlos y multiplicarlos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 45 years old, married, and the father of two children (ages 11 and 12). He is a resident of San Jacinto, a town in the Department of Bolívar, where he is well-known for being a good citizen and a meat vendor. Carlos has a butcher shop where he sells meat by the ounce, by the pound, or by the kilo according to the needs of his customers. His experience included a traditional upbringing. Carlos learned his trade from his father and now he has his own business, which allows him to earn enough income to support his family. However, he wants to grow his business so that he can provide for the greater welfare of his children while they are still young and in school.

Carlos sells his products for cash and also on credit. He has the necessary equipment for his job such as knives, cleavers, tables, and a freezer with very good storage capacity of which he needs to make more effective use. His plans going forward are to modernize his butcher shop with special machines and to secure a well-equipped location near his home. The greatest challenge he faces is dealing with the sporadic power outages that occur whenever the town has to perform maintenance and repairs. As a result, he has to resort to the old technique of salting the meats in order to preserve them. He encourages his customers to prepare a delicious stew that includes three types of salted meat. In the meantime, Carlos works toward generating a profit margin of no less than 17% from his sales. He continually strives to improve his operating capital by securing financing.

For this reason, he has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for his first loan. Using the Kiva funds, Carlos will buy meat in large amounts so that he can expand his customer base and sell more products to them. This will allow him to offer discounts so that he can attract and keep his customers.

loans.use: to purchase meat in bulk.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s grocery store business. His store is located in the market and he sells different grocery items to his clients such as cooking oil, sugar, spices, etc. at reasonable rates. He started this business two years ago and it has worked well for him. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity to sell in his store. 

Shazia is a housewife, staying at her home and doing her household responsibilities. She is very active in her work and takes care of her family very well. She has given birth to four children. Three of them are studying while the youngest one is not of school-going age yet. 

Shazia is confident that an investment will help her family to live a better financial life by improving her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Ana Sarai

texts.es:
Ana, tiene 21 años es madre soltera de una niña de 5 años, ella se dedica a la agricultura, compra todos los materiales y en ocasiones trabaja en el campo en compañía de su padrastro.
Actualmente iniciara la siembra de postrera, para lo cual solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en abono, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, con este préstamo podrá realizar una nueva siembra y obtener la cosecha que le sirve para consumo y para comercializar.
Su objetivo es tener los medios para realizar la siembra y llevarla a cabo, pues de esta actividad depende ella y su hija, espera que con el préstamo logre salir bien y su cultivo sea abundante.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old and the single mother of a 5-year-old daughter. She works in agriculture. She buys all of the supplies, and sometimes she works in the fields together with her stepfather. 

Currently, she is starting the last crop of the season, and she is requesting a loan so she can invest in compost and fertilizer for it, as well as paying farm workers. With this loan, she will be able to grow an additional crop and obtain the harvested produce, which is useful to her for consumption and sale. 

Ana's objective is to have the means to plant and harvest this crop, because this activity is the means of support for herself and her daughter. She hopes that with this loan, things will turn out well and her crop will be abundant.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer to plant corn.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 46-year-old married to Peter, and they do not have children.

She sells fish in the Kariobangi area. She has been doing this business for the last five years and gets an income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) every month.

She knew about KADET through marketing. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 20,000, with which she plans to purchase more stock of fish. She plans to use the anticipated profit to open a shop where she will be stocking fish.

She hopes to be the one supplying fish to big hotels. She is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fish.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de quesillos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de medio de vida. Maria tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en este negocio, ella se levanta temprano todos los días para salir a vender sus quesillos las ganas y el entusiasmo de proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento es para la compra de crema, tortillas, sal, cebollas, vinagre, bolsas, servilletas y queso que son necesarios para la elaboración de sus deliciosos quesillos.
texts.en: Maria Eugenia, 31, sells "quesillos" (cheese tortillas) for a living.  She has been in business for over seven years and enjoys what she does.  Maria is a very responsible person and dedicates a lot of time to her work.  She gets up early every morning to sell her products with enthusiasm in order to provide an income for her family.  The loan she is requesting is to buy cream, tortillas, salt, onions, vinegar, bags, napkins and cheese, which she needs to make her delicious "quesillos".

loans.use: To buy cream, tortillas, salt, onions, vinegar, bags, napkins and cheese.

loans.name: Mzinga Group

texts.en:
Ismail, who is in his late 40s, is married and has two children who are going to school.  He has been operating a furniture-mart since 1980.  He works from 8 am to 7pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use to buy more wood to make more furniture.  His dream is to one day be able to buy a machine to cut and plane wood.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mzinga", which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Hirma

texts.es:
La Sra. Hirma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 43 años y 2 hijos, solo uno está a su cargo y estudia aún la primaria. Se inició vendiendo salchipapas (comida al paso) en las afueras de su casa, dejó esta actividad porque su niño se econtraba enfermo, por ello decidió empezar con la venta de sus asados y parrillas (comidas típicas) con un capital inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para generar sus propios ingresos y poder apoyar económicamente en su hogar. 
Actualmente aumentó la variedad de sus productos, ahora vende juanes, pescados asados a la parrilla (comida típica) y refrescos, y cuenta con clientes fija.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará  productos en sacos como arroz, azúcar, jabas de huevos, aceitunas en kilos, carnes de pollo en kilos, pescados en kilos, sacos de carbón, también comprará ollas, platos, vasos y cubiertos y de esa manera captar nuevos clientes.
Hirma es una mujer luchadora  y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un Restaurante - Pollería, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Hirma belongs to the communal bank “Noche de Luna II” ("Moonlit Night II") from the District of Tarapoto, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 43 years old and married with two children. Only one of the children is under her care and still in elementary school.
She started out by selling salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dog) to passersby outside her house. She quit this business because her son was ill, so she decided to begin selling roasted and grilled meats with a start-up capital of 300 nuevos soles, in order to get an income of her own and provide financial support in her household. She has now increased the variety of her products - she sells juanes, roasted fish, and beverages, and has gotten regular customers.
With this loan of 1.700 nuevos soles she will purchase sacks of supplies such as rice and sugar; crates of eggs; olives, chicken and fish by the kilo; and sacks of charcoal. She will also purchase pots, plates, glasses and cutlery, in order to attract more customers.
Hirma is a fighter and a hardworking woman. Her dream is to own a restaurant with a chicken rotisserie. She is very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for giving women like her an opportunity so she can make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, crates of eggs, olives by the kilo and chicken.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria de 65 años de edad, vive en su propia casa junto a su querida hija. Victoria se dedica a la venta de deliciosos e higiénicos refrescos que ella misma prepara. Los cuales vende a la orilla de la calle cerca de su hogar de residencia. Es una zona muy estratégica, concurrida y segura en donde muchas personas caminan y deciden comprar los ricos frescos de Victoria. Ella ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia ya que es lo más importante y es quien le da las fuerzas para seguir adelante. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de sus ricos frescos tales como: cocos, melones, naranjas, limones, horchata, etc. espera lograr buenos resultados que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Victoria, age 65, lives in her own home with her beloved daughter. Victoria sells delicious and hygienically-prepared drinks that she makes herself. She sells them on the street near her home. This is a very strategic location, as it is highly-trafficked and secure. Many people walk buy and decide to buy Victoria's delicious drinks. She has worked all her life to get her family ahead, as this is the most important thing for her. She is the one who works hard to succeed. She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL with the goal of purchasing essentials for making her delicious refreshments, such as: coconut, melons, lemons, horchata [a cold, sweet drink made from tiger nuts and sugar], etc. She hopes to achieve good results that will allow her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy essentials: coconut, melons, oranges, lemons, horchata [a cold, sweet drink made from tiger nuts and sugar], etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 41 años es una luchadora madre soltera. Vive junto a sus 2 hijas: Salome y Noe, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Carita.  Ella trabaja muy duro para salir adelante; se siente satisfecha por todo lo obtenido hasta hoy. Desde hace 21 años se dedica a la siembra de papa, habas y alverja en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan paralelo a su casa, además cuenta con regadillo de agua a disposición. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las eternas horas que requiere para sacar el fruto maduro de la tierra; pues siente la alegría de poder vender sus cultivos después de tanto tiempo de trabajo. Según afirma en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de tarma le compran a muy buen precio sus cosechas. Su mayor dificultad son los gastos que realiza en los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, razón por la cual comenzó a realizar queso con la leche que produce las vacas que posee. Según cuenta cada día vende 5 moldes. Ahora está planeando viajar a la capital de país a comercializar sus sembríos, pues ahí son más cotizados. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “progreso carita”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, pues el apoyo que obtiene; le ayuda a seguir adelante. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. María está pensando sembrar papa de la variedad “yungay” y “andina”; por ello de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para comenzar con éxito la temporada agrícola.
texts.en:
María, age 41, is a determined single mother. She lives with her two daughters, Salome and Noe, in her own home in the village of Carita. María works very hard to get ahead and is satisfied with what she has obtained up to this point. For the past 21 years, she has been growing potatoes, beans, and peas on two hectares of farmland that is situated parallel to her house. She also has an irrigation system at her disposal. What she enjoys most about her work are the endless hours required to achieve ripe fruit from the land. María feels happy when she can sell her crops after investing so much time into her work. She says that the wholesale market in the city of Tarma buys her crops for a very good price. Her greatest difficulty is paying the expenses related to her children’s university studies. For this reason, she began making cheese using the milk produced by her cows. María says that she sells five cheese molds every day. Now she is planning to travel to Lima in order to sell her crops because there is more demand.

María is a member of the Communal Bank “Progreso Carita” and this will be her tenth loan with MFP. She feels fulfilled because of the support she has received so that she can continue pressing forward. In addition, she promises to be prompt with her payments. María is planning to plant potatoes of the “Yungay” and “Andina” varieties. For this reason, she will invest the money she requested in the purchase of natural fertilizers so that she can begin a successful farming season.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a single woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and house rent. 

She has operated a beauty salon for the past three years; her potential clients are friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of competition from other beauty salon operators. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it offers a variety of loan products.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is 57 and has been in farming for 10 years producing milk, vegetables and maize for the local market. He is married with 6 children; all adults, except for the last born who is still in school.

Michael has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilmo to construct a greenhouse for growing tomatoes. He also plans to add dairy cows to his five dairy cows in five years. The loan will help improve his income, educate his youngest child, and improve family living standards.

He mentions animal diseases as his major challenge.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Domingga

texts.en:
Domingga is married with five adult children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Domingga is a farmer and specializes in rice production to earn a living. Domingga has been doing this for 20 years. Domingga has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm. 

Domingga has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to make her business successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de producir mayores ingresos a su familia, ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un comal de metal, pago para la reparación de la plancha, compra de unos quintales de maíz. Ella a través de los préstamos ha mejorado sus ventas, ya que cuenta con disponibilidad de materiales y en esta ocasión nuevamente comprara maíz para tener disponible.
texts.en: Mary decided on a new loan because she needs to produce higher income for her family.  She’s asking for the loan to buy a metal griddle, to pay to have her tortilla press repaired and to buy a few quintals of corn.  Through the loans she’s managed to improve her sales because she has materials on hand and on this occasion she’ll buy corn again to have it available.

loans.use: to buy a metal griddle, repair the tortilla press and to buy a few quintals of corn.

loans.name: Marubeni

texts.es: Marubeni, de 37 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive con Digno, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos de 12 y 2 años, habitando una casa que es de su propiedad, la cual lograron comprar a base de mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Marubeni es la venta de comida, como menú y platos extras, contando con un pequeño local que logró ambientar en su propia casa, en donde coloco mesas y sillas necesarias para atender cómodamente a sus clientes. Con sus deliciosos platillos, y la buena sazón que aprendió de su madre, logró ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes desde hace 5 años, tiempo que viene funcionando su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el tener un ingreso económico con el cual apoya en los gastos del hogar a su pareja, ya que muchas veces con los ingresos de empleado en una entidad privada no les alcanzaba, fue entonces decidió iniciar su negocio. Sin embargo le reculta muy agotador al termino de cada día de trabajo, pero eso no la desanima y sigue trabajando, deseosa de progresar. Sus planes es crecer su negocio, mejorar el ambiente y variar sus platillos. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en mejorar los ambientes de su local, como el pintado de paredes, arreglos del piso, acabados de los servicios higiénicos, para poder brindar un ambiente más cómodo a sus clientes y seguir teniendo sus preferencias.
texts.en:
37-year-old Marubeni is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She lives with Digno and they have two children aged 12 and 2.  They live in their own home which they managed to buy with a lot of effort.  Marubeni's business is selling food such as set menus and á la carte dishes.  She has a small sales location which she managed to set up in her own home, in which she set up the tables and chairs she needs to serve her customers comfortably.  With her delicious dishes and the good flavor that she learned from her mother, she has gained the loyalty of her customers who she has served for five years.  What Marubeni likes about her business is having an income which she can use to support her partner with the household expenses as he works for a private company and his income often doesn't reach far enough.  For this reason, she decided to start her own business.  However, her work is very exhausting and she is tired at the end of every work day.  This does not discourage her though and she continues working with a desire to make progress.  Her plans are to grow her business, improve her premises and vary her dishes.

This will be Marubeni's fifth loan from MFP.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit which she can use to make progress in her business.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  Marubeni will use the sum of 2,000 soles that she has requested to invest in improving her business premises, painting the walls, repairing the floor and finishing off the bathrooms, so that she can provide her customers with a better atmosphere and thereby keep their loyalty.

loans.use: to buy paint, lay flooring and improve her bathroom infrastructure

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Teresa has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy fish to sell.

Teresa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Cristian Antonio

texts.es: Cristian, esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo ya que comprara  otros cerdos para la granja, para la temporada de Navidad quiere tener disponibilidad a los clientes que en su cena incluyen la carne de cerdo. Préstamos le han permitido mantener la alimentacion de su familia, pues el anterior prestamo lo invirtio en insumos agricolas, dandole adecuadamente los cuidados al cultivo, cambiando sus circunstancias y el nivel de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Cristian is requesting a new loan as he would like to buy some more pigs for his farm.  During the Christmas season, he would like to have produce available for his customers who include pork as part of their dinner.  The loans that he has received have allowed Cristian to provide food for his family.  He invested his previous loan in buying farm supplies so that he could provide suitable care for his crops.  This improved his situation and also improved his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Jose tiene 30 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Jose necesita algún tipo de ayuda para poder comprar algunas semillas para sembrar en un terreno heredado por sus padres, ya que se le dificulta sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

Es por eso que Jose está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢597,000.00 (quinientos noventa y siete mil colones), esto para comprar semillas y lograr cultivar plátano, y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Jose es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 and lives with his family in the community of San Carlos, in the Costa Rican province of Alajuela.  He lives in an area that occupies the first place nationally in the production of coffee and sugar cane.  The area also produces basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, tubers and vegetables.  The Juan Santamaría International Airport, the most important of the country, is also located in this province.

For some time, Jose has needed help to buy seeds to plant on land inherited from his parents, so that he can support his children.  For this reason, Jose is requesting a loan in the amount of $1200 (597000 CRC), with which he can buy seeds and afford his family a better standard of living.

Jose is a member of the Community Credit Corporation of El Encanto de Pital.  This is his first loan through one of the 150 branches of Kiva partner EDESA found in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to cultivate banana plants.

loans.name: Luz Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, vive por la comunidad Zhidmad en Cuenca, este lugar se encuentra rodeado de exuberante vegetación natural, es un lugar donde se respira la paz y tranquilidad ya que se encuentra fuera del ruido de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Luz tiene 39 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su tercer hijo pasa en casa y le ayuda en los quehaceres de su hogar y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Luz se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa su mayor tiempo en casa cría ganado, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. También labora en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para su consumo. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 10 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos. 

Su meta es tener un negocio como una tienda.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the communal bank Zhidmad. She lives in the community of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a place which is surrounded by exuberant natural vegetation. It is a place where one breathes peace and tranquility, since it is located outside of the noise of the city. The people there raise animals, work in agriculture, or many work in the city. They maintain the culture and traditions of their towns.

Luz is 39 years old, married, and in her marriage has conceived 4 children who are now 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old. Her first two children work and help her financially. Her third child stays at home and helps with the household chores, and the last is studying in a local school. Her husband works in construction as a mason. The house in which she lives is her own. 

Luz takes care of the household chores and, since she spends most of her time at home, raises cattle, pigs, chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells when she has the financial need. She also works in agriculture, and what she grows is only for their own consumption. 

She has been a member of the bank for 10 years, and she will invest the new loan in purchasing chickens. 

Her goal is to have a business like a store.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Karla está en la etapa final de su carrera de Arquitectura. Y está solicitando el crédito para pagar eñ curso de graduación, que tiene una duración de 6 meses. Espera poder independizarse y tener sus  propios logros, también le inspiran sus padres. En un futuro quiere tener su propia constructora o trabajar en proyectos supervisando obras. Quiere demostrar todo lo que puede hacer en el plano profesional.
texts.en: Karla is in the final stage of her program in architecture, and she is requesting the loan to pay for a graduation course, which lasts six months.  She hopes to be able to become independent and have her own achievements.  Her parents also inspire her.  In the future she wants to have her own construction company or work as a project supervisor.  She wants to demonstrate everything she can do on a professional level.

loans.use: to pay for a graduation course.

loans.name: Parcelle Assainie Pc 1 Group

texts.fr: le groupe a été crée depuis le 01/12/2008. les membres habitent le même quartier et font toute le commerce . Dialé est née le 11/02/1956 elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfant dont 1 garçon et 4 filles. Elle fait du commerce en ouvrant une boutique d'alimentation et un atelier de couture chez elle. elle achète la marchandise au grand marché de la ville et va a la capital pour les tissus.Avec ses bénéfice elle renforce son fond de roulement et assure les petites dépenses de ses enfants.Elle est debout a l’extrême droite de photo et a levé sa main
texts.en: This group was created on December 1, 2008. The members live in the same district, and they all work in commerce. Dialé was born on February 11, 1956 and is a married mother of five children (one boy and four girls). She is in business by having opened a grocery store and a sewing workshop in her home. She purchases merchandise at the big market in town and goes to the capital for the cloth. With her profits, she bolsters her working capital and ensures that the children's sundry expenses are covered. Dialé is the one standing with her hand raised at the far right in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Dutezanyimbere Cb Group

texts.en: Dutezanyimbere is a group composed of different members who sell different products.  They are dedicated to upholding their business values.  Valentine is a group leader, and is married with four children.  She sells different items in her boutique, such as soap, salt, and cooking oil. Profits will be used to reinvest in the business.  In the picture, there is a young girl with her mother in the front row, while Valentine holds the Kiva borrower profile form.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes' group is comprised of two hard-working women. Agnes is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and soap. 

To help expand her business, Agnes  has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beans and millet flour for the shop, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and to expand the business. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to help her family. 
 
Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase beans and millet flour for her shop

loans.name: Vidole Group

texts.fr: VIDOLE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Hortense (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 47 ans. Hortense a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Hortense est mariée à un certain Ernest. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Hortense et son mari. Pour cette raison, Hortense vend des conserves et des boissons dans sa région depuis cinq, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Hortense s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Hortense sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe VIDOLE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des conserves et des boissons.

loans.name: Linet's Group

texts.en:
Linet is 45 years old, has 4 children, and lives in Kanyakuno B village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya. Kanyakuno B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Ligodho well. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases, meaning that Linet and her family may fall sick and become unable to work or attend school.

Linet works as a business owner, but has also volunteered her time to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser program that enables her community to drink safe water and stay healthy. Linet and another promoter in her community, Truphena, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Linet will encourage the community to treat their water with the dispenser and refill the dispenser with chlorine as needed. Linet wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will reduce water-borne diseases in her community.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Linet’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To support an innovative water treatment technology - chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: A trained fashion designer. Mrs. Dora O. a 55 years old dedicated woman and a leader of one LAPO groups in Nigeria. She has 10 years experience in fashion design. She is looking forward to having the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and clothes for sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells cosmetics. Maria began her business with $100 in capital. At the beginning she just sold cosmetics but now she also sells costume jewelry. Maria hopes to establish a store to display her merchandise. She will use the loan to invest in merchandise purchased on sale and therefore be able to offer competetive prices. She believes that these new products will help her business grow. Maria is single and 28 years old. Through this business Maria helps her family. Maria hopes that this loan will give her fanancial stability and allow her to save for her future.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Maria tiene ventas de cosméticos. Maria empezó su negocio con un capital de 100 dólares. Al principio ella solo vendía cosméticos, pero ahora también vende bisutería. Maria aspira establecer un local para exhibir su mercadería. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en compras de mercadería a precios de ofertas y así vender a precios competitivos. Ella tiene la fe que con estos nuevos productos su negocio seguirá creciendo. Maria esta soltera, Ella tiene 28 años. Ella por medio de su negocio apoya a su familia. Maria tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le permitirá tener estabilidad económica y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: To establish a store

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother of six. Her partner was not there to support her and she has had to work very hard to provide food and education for children. She runs her own food service for construction workers, where she has realized the great need that they have for food. One of her daughters helps her and she has seen her business prosper.

At this time, Silvia needs a loan in the amount of $750, which she will use to purchase ingredients needed for food preparation. She pledges to repay this amount within 6 to 12 months. She sincerely thanks you for any help you can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations

La señora Silvia es madre soltera de seis hijos, ella no contó con el apoyo de su pareja por lo que ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para darles sostén y educación a sus hijos. Silvia tiene su propio negocio en el que vende comidas principalmente en las obras en construcción, donde se ha dado cuenta de la gran demanda de alimentos por parte de los albañiles y personas que laboran en estos lugares, con la ayuda de una de sus hijas ha visto crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos, Silvia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que requiere en la elaboración de las comidas, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Ella agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darle.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo has over 3 years of experience in trade. She is divorced and she has 2 children. She lives with her father and her brother’s family now. After her divorce, Marhabo was in a difficult situation. She did not have regular work to support her family. She decided to sells brooms because it was their family business. Her mother was a broom maker and taught Marhabo and her brother to make brooms as children. Her father sold brooms in the market.

But now Marhabo’s mother is dead and her father is old and could not help her financially. Her brother has one place for trade and he helped Marhabo rent a place to sell brooms. Marhabo’s children and father prepare the brooms for market. They paint and dry brooms under the sun and then Marhabo and her brother sell them in their business places. You can see Marhabo, her son and her brother in the photo.

Additionally they have 40 hens and 80 chickens at home. They usually deliver about 20-30 eggs for sale to the canteens every day. Now Marhabo is requesting $1000 to purchase 4000 brooms.

loans.use: Purchase of 4000 brooms

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
"My business is progressing with LAPO loans," say Mrs. Joy E.. She is 42, married with three children. She sells clothes, shoes, bags and costume jewelery in her boutique and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Joy needs a loan in the amount of US$ 1,175 to improve her business by purchasing more items for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags and costume jewelery for her micro-business' inventory

loans.name: Bariatou

texts.fr:
Bariatou A. is married and without children. She was born on March 22, 1987, in Lomé. Currently she does not work, and her spouse, an upholsterer, has not been able to provide for all the needs of the family. Ms. A. would like a loan of $300 to start an onion business in order to help her husband with household expenses. She resides in Adéwui and often helps him in his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Femme mariée sans enfant, madame Bariatou A. est née le 22 mars 1987 à Lomé. Actuellement, elle n’exerce aucun métier et son conjoint étant tapissier n’arrive pas à subvenir à tous les besoins de la famille. Madame Bariatou A. souhaiterait avoir un financement de $300 pour se lancer dans le commerce d’oignons afin aider son mari dans les charges de la maison. Elle réside à Adéwui et aide souvent le mari dans son atelier.

loans.use: Commerce in onions

loans.name: Anonymous
