loans.use: To purchase bicycles to sell during the holiday season and to continue supplying his workshop with necessary supplies

loans.name: Dawood

texts.en: Dawood lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son. He was out of the country for about 8 years and when he came back two years ago he got married and opened a retail shop and attracted good numbers of clients. Now he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to help his wife and his son. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Carlota Luis

texts.pt:
Carlota Luísa T. was born in the city of Maputo in the province of Maputo. She has 7 siblings, they are orphans. She was raised in the district of Boane where she still lives. She started primary school in Boane but did not attend secondary school because at that time Mozambique culture did not accept girls attending secondary school and she did not want to contradict her family.

Carlota was married but her husband died leaving her with 5 children to care for. She supported them through commerce. She heard of HLUVUKU-ADSEMA from her brother and friends. She has already borrowed twice, both times 5.000mt, which she repaid. Carlota is requesting a loan of 20000mt. Her dream is to see her home finished and her business doing well so she can support her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 2 Cliente: Carlota Luisa T. Actividade: Comércio Valor do empréstimo: 20.000,00mt Aplicação: Compra de mercadoria para revenda Início: 28/01/08 Fim: 22-05-09

Carlota Luísa T., nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província de Maputo. Tem 7 irmaos dos quais 2 são homens, é orfã de pai e mãe. Cresceu no distrito de Boane e vive até hoje. Começou a estudar na escola primária Boane sede. Não frequentou o nível secundário por ter ido ao lar com os seus 20 anos de idade visto que naquele tempo, ir a escola não havia muita aceitação para os moçambicanos e não deixando de lado a tradicao da sua família. Depois de começar a viver maritalmente, o seu marido vem a falecer deixando com ela 5 filhos dos quais 3 são rapazes e duas meninas. 3

Durante este tempo ela vive com base da actividade comercial estando de momento a tratar o assunto da pensão de sobrevivencia para seus filhos. Ouviu falar da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA apatir do seu irmão e amigas do mercado e decidiu aproximar-se para ter melhor esclarecimento e requisitos para aceder ao credito. Assim, reunindo requisitos, teve dois empréstimos um de 5.000,00MT e tendo pago sem nenhum constrangimento. Depois destes remeteu o seu terceiro pedido no valor de 20.000,00MT que ainda esta por ser financiado. Tem como seu maior sonho ver sua casa concluída e sua actividade comercia desenvolver muito bem pra poder sustentar seus filhos.

loans.use: To buy material to finish up her house

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma is a very diligent mother who has worked in different fields throughout her life but always with the security and well-being of her beloved children as her main goal. Her constant search for sustenance drove her to open a small general store in a commercial property she rented in the downtown area. She named it "Los Gemelos" (the twins) in honor of her children. She works in her store every day and has now decided to increase her capital in order to stock her store with a higher quantity and better quality of products. She hopes that this will satisfy her clients' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Irma, es una diligente madre de familia que a lo largo de su vida ha desarrollado diferentes actividades con el único propósito de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos hijos.Su constante observación y búsqueda de sustento la llevaron a aperturar una pequeña bodeguita en un local que alquiló para desarrollar esta actividad en el centro de la ciudad y en honor a sus queridos hijos les puso “Los Gemelos”.Diariamente se desempeña en este espacio y ha decidido incrementar su capital de inversión para acrecentar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos, a fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to stock her store with a higher quantity and better quality of products.

loans.name: Nora Eneida

texts.es:
Ms. Nora Sánchez lives in an area of common land near to Victoria city, Tamaulipas, since there are no job opportunities for women other than housekeeping in the area where she lives. The economic situation is difficult, and that's why she decided to open her own business, since she didn't have money, is a single mom, and needs to maintain her child. After giving it some thought, she decided to work on her own. She started her business 5 years ago and she sells used clothing and novelties. She started with very little amount of merchandise that she sold to her friends, until she increased her list of customers. Thanks to this business she earned money for her child's schooling and for her home.

Ms. Sánchez is currently asking for a loan of US $575 that she will return in 6 months. This loan will help her to purchase merchandise since she already sold all the merchandise that she had and wasn't able to purchase more due to the lack of resources. Please help Nora so she can continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Nora Sánchez ella vive en un ejido cercano a ciudad Victoria, Tamaulipas, debido a que no hay oportunidades de trabajo para la mujer mas que el de la casa, y la situación económica es difícil, por esta razón se decidió a iniciar su propio negocio ya que no tenia dinero y ella estaba sola con su hijo y entonces tenia que obtener dinero para mantenerlo. Después de un tiempo de estar pensando que podía hacer para mejorar su situación, hasta que un día se le ocurrió trabajar por su cuenta. Su negocio comenzó hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y novedades, al principio inicio con poca mercancía vendiendo entre amigas y poco a poco se fue haciendo de clientela. Gracias a esto obtuvo dinero para los gastos de escuela de su hijo y de su casa.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que esta dispuesta a pagar en 6 meses, este la va a ayudar a surtir mercancía ya que vendió toda la que tenía y debido a la falta de recursos no ha podido surtir más. Contribuye con Nora para que pueda continuar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Asha's Tukubaliane Group

texts.en:
Asha is married with 3 children, ages 20, 18, and 15. She has a business selling charcoal, which she started 2 years ago.

Asha hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She is a member of the Tukubaliane loan group and will be sharing this loan with Beshul, Stil, and Zuhura. All of the members of this loan group live in the same neighborhood and guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia is 34 years old and she has a grade 2 education, and she is in charge of her household. She lives with her two sons and two daughters, all whom are minors. Only one of her sons and one of her daughters are in school. She speaks mostly Aymara language and her husband died four years ago.

She is a member of the Community Bank Caluyo in the community of Santa Rosa in the Sakakatani sector in the district and province of Yunguyo. She has been receiveing credits since 2004, her first loan being S/ 300. With it, she and her husband purchased 3 pigs and 2 sacks of feed.

With this loan in the amount of S/1,800, which will be repaid in a term of 6 months, she will purchase feed to fatten her pigs.

She currently tends to raising pigs and cattle, because raising only pigs generates income only for a short time and in the mean time she raises the others will the sales carry out in a span of 4 month. This way she can ensure that she always has money in her pocket.

She is very happy being a member of the community bank. Her greatest dream is to secure a greater capital to acquire more livestock and sell them directly to the consumers. She will be able to sell her products in the city of Arequipa.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Basilia tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta el segundo grado de primaria y es jefa de su hogar. Vive con sus dos hijos y dos hijas quienes son menores de edad y solo están en la escuela una mujer y un varón. Ella habla más el idioma aymara y su esposo falleció hace cuatro años. Es socia del Banco Comunal Progreso Caluyo de la comunidad Villa Santa Rosa Sector Sakakatani del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, ella trabaja con préstamo desde el año 2004 y su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00; con dicho dinero con su esposo decidieron comprar 3 chanchos y 02 sacos de afrecho. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, ella comprara alimento para engordar a los chanchos. Ella actualmente se dedica al engorde de chancho y ganado vacuno, porque el primero le genera a corto tiempo sus ingresos económicos y mientras la segunda demora un periodo de tres a cuatro meses para su venta, de esa manera garantiza a que no le falte el dinero en el bolsillo. Se siente muy contenta de trabajar y ser parte del Banco Comunal Progreso Caluyo, su sueño mas grande es tener mayor capital para adquirir mas ganado vacuno y comercializar directamente al consumidor, para ello adquirir una movilidad que le permita trasladar sus productos hacia la ciudad Arequipa.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok T. earns income selling fish. She has been involved in this business for the past nine years and typically earns US$4 per day. T. purchases fish stocks from wholesale fishing businesses in the village and then sells them for profit in the local market. Her husband is a farmer and a palm-juice maker. He earns approximately US$3 per day. Mrs. Sok T. and her husband both live in the Sangkemeanchey Village, Siem Reap Province. 

Currently, T. would like to expand her fish sales business and is therefore requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase more fish stocks for sale and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of fish for sale

loans.name: Riziki's Shukrani Group

texts.en:
Riziki is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children ages 4, 8, and 15. Riziki opened her own tailoring business in 2006, and works everyday from 7 AM to 10 PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from sales.

Riziki is now requesting a loan in order to expand the number of items she can sell. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who all have businesses selling various foods such as tea, cashews, and rice.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Francisco Xavier

texts.es:
Francisco lives in the Hialeah IV etapa neighborhood. She has lived there with his family since he was a child. He is now married and has a 6 year old son. His wife's name is Fabiola Marenco and she is a housewife. She is now thinking about looking for a job so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. Francisco is a driver with 5 years of experience.

The loan he is requesting will be used to make improvements to his home, specifically for the purchase of ceramic tile for his living room. He also has a truck that is in bad shape and he hopes to be able to fix it so that he can start a transportation business. In this manner he hopes to increase his family's income and help his son, who is growing and will need it for his education.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Francisco habita en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa, desde niño ha habitado en ese barrio con su familia, es casado y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, su esposa se llama Fabiola Marenco y es ama de casa, ella está pensando en la idea de buscar trabajo para apoyar a su marido en los gastos del hogar. Francisco es conductor y tiene cinco años de experiencia en esta actividad, el dinero que está solicitando es para hacer mejoras en su casa en la compra de cerámica para ponerla en la sala. Tiene una camioneta que está en mal estado, espera poder repararla, y empezar un negocio de acarreo para tener más ingresos para su familia. Su hijo está creciendo y los gastos de estudios están aumentando.

loans.use: To purchase ceramic tile for his home

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 60 años. Ella tiene un negocio familiar, junto a sus 3 hijas. Se dedican al bordado computarizado en su taller que funciona en su vivienda.
Actualmente el negocio de mercedes tiene gran producción gracias a la maquina de coser industrial que lograron adquirir con los créditos que recibió anteriormente.

Mercedes cuenta que desea incrementar su producción y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella requiere un crédito para comprar materiales que necesita para trabajar.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 60 years of age. She has a family business with her three daughters. They do computerized embroidery in their shop which is in their home.

Currently, Mercedes's business has great production thanks to the industrial sewing machine they succeeded in buying with the previous loans she has received.

Mercedes reports that she wants to increase production and make her business grow. She needs a loan to buy materials that she needs to work.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her textile business

loans.name: Maria Danelia

texts.es:
Maria Danelia es una dama cuya labor es la venta de productos lácteos como lo son queso, cuajada y crema vendidos en su municipio de Chichigalpa específicamente en el mercado municipal de esta comunidad.

Con un hijo en la obligación de mantener y por ser madre soltera ha hecho grandes esfuerzos para salir adelante y gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel ha logrado mantener su negocio y al mismo tiempo suplir las necesidades de su pequeño hijo ya que hace el papel de padre y madre a la vez. La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un nuevo crédito para continuar con la compra de los productos lácteos para su respectiva comercialización en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa.
texts.en:
Maria Danelia is a lady whose profession is selling dairy products such as cheese, curd and cream in the town of Chichigalpa, and specifically in the local market of this community.

As a single mother with a child under her care, Maria Danelia has made great efforts to succeed. Thanks to the support given from Ceprodel, she has managed to keep up her business and therefore meet the needs of her young son in her role as both his mother and father. The reason why she has come to Ceprodel is to solicit a new loan is in order to continue purchasing dairy products for marketing and sale in the local Chichigalpa market.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of milk

loans.name: Ramzo

texts.en: Ramzo Hojievais 48 years old and has three children.  For over six years, Ramzo has owned a specialized fabrics store in the central market of Isfara, where she produces traditional dresses that are commonly used in dowries throughout Tajikistan.  Through hard work, perseverance, and the application of her integrity, Ramzo's fabrics store has become one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market where she works.  But Ramzo is an ambitious businesswomen and would like to increase her profits and thereby save enough money to put her children through school.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1000, which she will use to increase her inventory of fabrics.

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of fabrics for making dresses.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Christina K., a 38-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 12 and 16 years old.

Christina has been running a charcoal sales business since 2007: these small, black, dirty pieces of dry earth are important to the people of Tanzania because they rely on charcoal to cook meals on a daily basis. Indeed, many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light them. Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, the charcoal-selling business is quite lucrative. She works at her business 12 hours per day, 7 days per week, though she notes that she is assisted by one employee. By doing so, Christina currently earns approximately $55 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to purchase more charcoal for resale purposes. In the future, she plans to expand her charcoal business. Christina thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional charcoal

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. Rosa is 45 years old and married with four children. Rosa has a fruit juice stand at the Miraflores market, where she works with her son. Rosa also has another market stand, where she sells potatoes that she buys from local farmers. Rosa needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy potatoes in bulk. Rosa dreams of improving her business and that her children will continue to study so that they can grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Rosa es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado de Miraflores en donde prepara jugo de frutas, con la ayuda de su hijo. Además Rosa tiene otro puesto en donde vende papa, que adquiere de los productores. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa por mayor. Rosa sueña con mejorar sus negocio y que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales.

loans.use: Buy potatoes in bulk for her market stand

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary K. is 53 years old. She is married and given birth to seven children. She sells porridge and kose at her neighborhood. She lives and trades at Abofour in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Mary loves selling these foods, a business through which she obtains her daily bread to cater for her household. 

Kose is prepared from milled beans and soybeans with pepper, and afterwards it is fried and taken with the porridge. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or kose. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, beans and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school. 

Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Jacob’. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress. And she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, and milk etc.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Холова Гулдаста 1964 года рождения. Она замужем и у них 4 детей. Она выбрала для себя особое направление в бизнесе. Приготовление и продажа продуктов питания в городе Вахдат. Там можно вкусно пообедать, выпить зеленого чая, прохладительными напитками  утолить жажду. Недавно она услышала о программе Кива и с ее помощью хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев, для закупа продуктов питания.
texts.en:
Guldasta H. was born in 1964. She is married with four children and lives in Vakhdat. She has her own business. She cooks and sells food. At Guldasta's place one can enjoy lunch and satisfy thirst with a cup of green tea. Recently Guldasta has heard of Kiva and decided to apply for a six-month loan of 2000 somoni. She will use the loan to buy groceries and increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn L. is a hardworking fisherwoman. She has been catching fish since she was a small child. Her father influenced her love of the sea. She says, "treasures like what we saw in some American films are found beneath the salt water". 

She is thirty years old and has five children studying in school. She knows for sure that her children are counting on their parents to enable their continued schooling. As a mother, she wants to give her children the best life she can. She is grateful that her husband, Evaristo, is ever willing to provide for their needs.

She is asking for a loan of $250 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. Aside from their catch, Edelyn buys other fish to sell in the market. The loan will definitely help her market more fish and earn a bigger profit.

CEVI gives her credit assistance to run her business. She also receives training and insurance coverage to help her small "fish" enterprise to grow.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya (sont toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. .
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente des pagnes wax, des fruits, du haricot préparé et des draps cousus.
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Ce  prêt servira à  acheter, 4 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 kg de tissus de draps, 1sac de 100 kg d’haricot,  1bidon de 20 litres d’huile et 5 sacs de fruits (oranges, ananas et bananes). Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et les localités avoisinantes mais aussi au Burkina faso. 
Les marchandises sont vendues aux différents marchés de Sikasso ville, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers et devant la porte familiale à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group (all married) have an average age of 32 and, on average, 4 children.They mostly live in monogamous families in Ouayerma, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali). They have various businesses, among others the sale of high quality "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), fruit, cooked beans, and finished bedsheets.

They are working together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time. This loan will serve to buy 4 lengths of "wax pagne", 15 kg of cloth for making sheets, 1 100-kg sack of dried beans, 1 jerrycan of 20 liters of oil, and 5 sacks of fruit (oranges, pineapple, and bananas). They buy their supplies in the big market of the town of Sikasso and surrounding areas, but also in Burkina Faso.

Their merchandise is sold in the various markets of the town of Sikasso, on foot in the residential neighborhoods and in front of their homes, to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 22.500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest will be reinvested into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
Fatuma Z., 34, is married with two children, ages 17 and 5. She has had a food business for six years. She works daily from 5 a.m. until 4 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $148.

This will be Fatum’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She wants to use this loan to increase capital and buy a big stock of food.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, Puma, which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Fatuma is first on the right, with a head covering of white material.

loans.use: To increase capital and buy a good stock of food

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас Шуайбова 1975 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей.  Мукаддас  дома разводит скот. Скот отправляет в горы на пастбище и пасется вместе с соседями и их скотом до вечера. Муж работает фермером  на ферме выращивает различные сельскими хозяйственными культурами. Осенью они продают огурцы и помидоры. В начале весны фрукты. Она обратилась в Микроинвест за поддержкой , покупки скота. Она благодарна КИВА что поддержали и не отказали ей.
texts.en:
Mukaddas S. was born in 1975 and is married with three children. She tends to the cattle and sends it to the pastures along with her neighbors' cattle. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates a variety of fruit and vegetables. In the fall Mukaddas and her husband sell cucumbers and tomatoes. In the spring they sell fruit. She turned to Microinvest for helping her buy more cattle. She is grateful to Kiva for its support and she is happy that she has not been rejected.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming

loans.name: John

texts.en:
“Success is the result of our patience and hard work and our struggle to overcome failures.” says John.

This idea motivated him in bringing out his best to become a productive raiser of poultry. John is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos that will be used in the maintenance of his poultry business, which he runs in his local village of Malibabag Peñablanca, Cagayan. His wife Maymona works as hired laborer sometimes to generate extra income for their family needs. He hopes that through the loan and through proper business maintenance, John will be able to develop his business well and will able to meet his family’s daily needs.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Мунаввар

texts.ru: Мунаввар А. – женщина 39 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей мужской и детской одежды на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Мунаввар закупает свой товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан. Мунаввар хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Мунаввар кредитуется в нашей организации с 2004 года. Она очень надежный и аккуратный клиент. Всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. В этот раз Мунаввар предпочла взять займ для закупки летней мужской и детской одежды.
texts.en:
Munavar is a 39-year-old woman. She's married with 2 children and has a middle-school education. She earns her living selling men's and children's clothing at the Farovon Market in the city of Gafurov. She buys her goods at the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She would like to increase the selection of goods she sells because a good selection draws a greater clientele. Munavar has been borrowing from our organization since 2004. She is a very dependable and punctual woman. She always makes good use of her loans. Munavar is seeking a loan at this time to buy men's and children's summer apparel.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's and children's summer apparel

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda makes a living managing a general store and raising hogs.  She is happy because she has been able to improve her businesses despite starting with little capital. Her store is two years old and located in her village of Masaya, San Agsutin, Isabela. She has applied for a loan to expand her store and hopefully generate a larger income, which she can use to provide for the needs of her family. 

Belinda is married to Ronald and blessed with six children: Karen - 13 years old; Kristine - 11 years old; Don - 9 years old; Hannah - 8 years old; Dominic - 6 years old; and Aimee - 4 years old. Belinda hopes to be able to send all of her children to school someday, including college.

loans.use: To expand a small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and other equipment for tailoring business.

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en: Hakima is a hardworking woman and, since 1999, has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Tursunzade. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. Hakima is the mother of three children that she would like to offer an education as they are minors. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood, working hard labor. To realize this dream, Hakima now requests 2,000 Somoni. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her range of vegetables

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila M. is 62 years old and is happy with her supportive husband and her seven children that she cares for.

Precila is a rice grower and started her farm in 1967. She helps her husband manage a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. Before her first loan in Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), it was really difficult to sustain her livelihood.

Precila has requested a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to finance her farm like buying fertilizer and seed. She hopes everything will result in prosperity and an abundant harvest for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: James Mwenda

texts.en: Mr. James M. is 47 years old. He is married to Joyce Mwendwa and is the father of three school-going children. James has a seat-cushion-making business that he has been running for the last nineteen years on a busy street in Narok town. James learned about KADET from a friend who is already a registered client. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to expand his business by buying more stock to meet his customers’ demands. He hopes to use the profits from the proceeds of this loan to expand his business and employ more people. James’ future dream is that he will be able to build his own house for business and also a residential one for himself and his family. James believes he is hardworking and only needs resources to attain his goal. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more material like leather for seat covers and seat cushions

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Long Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap L. is a village bank president who has been selected by the ten clients in Chrouy village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sopheap L. is fruit seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell in her current business. Her husband, Mr. Ngaet Bo, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. Mrs. Sopheap L. is 38 years old and the mother of four children three of who are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because they are at the age of 5 years old. 

Eight members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to re-sell in her current business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn C. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Jocelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz D. is a typical mother who wishes nothing more in life but for her children to finish college and to get the family out of poverty. Together with her loving and supportive partner in life, she works hard to earn money for the everyday expenses of her family. However, her business is still too small to earn enough for their daily financial needs. 

Therefore, Luz is requesting for a loan through ASHI for capital to expand her business. She is very eager for this vision because, without her business, she and her husband could have no other means to earn as much as possible. While her two children (now ages 7 and 10) are young, Luz wants to invest more money through loan so it reaches sustainability.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing and selling food

loans.name: Sheilah Veb

texts.en:
Sheilah Veb E. is from the village of San Isidro, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 27 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sheilah Veb owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Sheilah Veb has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sheilah Veb joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel A. R., tiene la edad de 58 años, está  casado, y tiene una hija que es su mayor prioridad. Ella tiene 20 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia  a una plantación de café que posee. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Israel  trabaja  desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Israel A. R., 58, is married and has a 20-year-old daughter, who is his greatest priority in life. He wants financing to buy natural fertilizer to enrich his coffee plantation. He wants to properly care for his plants so that his crop yields will be optimum thereby producing better earnings. This isn't his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms agreed upon. He has been a farmer for many years. He hopes in the future to offer his family a better quality of life and economic stability and to be able to continue to grow both as a person and as a grower. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say P., 44, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She grows and sells vegetables at the local market to earn a living. She is able to make about US$4.50 of profit every day, while her husband, who is a moto-taxi driver, is able to make US$8 in revenue a day. This couple has five children: two of whom are students and three of whom are employed to help raise the standard of living. Say P. is asking for a loan of US$800 to make a new investment. She will use this money to invest in a fruit stand.

loans.use: To invest in a fruit stand.

loans.name: Begidjon

texts.en: K. Begidjon is from a natural born agricultural family. With immense strength of character, she has observed that only labor with much dedication rewards with good vegetables. With this conception, she has worked her lands, cultivating products native to the region such as potatoes and corn, among others. Begidjon is a widow and the mother of one child. She feels more responsibility to continue with her daily labor. Some time ago she acquired a small quantity of small animals to satisfy the hunger of her family in an epoch of shortage. In return, while watching her cultivated lands, she leaves the little animals free so that they can locate their daily sustenance. Begidjon seeks a loan of 3,000 Somoni to invest in seeds and mineral fertilizer to improve the quality of her produce. Let's support this brave mother who has respectable goals to improve her living condition for the sake of the dearest person in her life – her daughter. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es:
Mónica P. de 50 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana su casa esta ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, no esta casada pero tiene 2 hijos de 16 que estudia en colegio fiscal y de 25 años que estudia en la universidad.

Mónica comenzó con un negocio de comidas pero como no le resulto en su sector vender comida, comenzó con el reciclaje de tapas, botellas, plásticos todos esto los consigue en el basurero principal de guayaquil. Ella ahora recicla tapas, botellas, plásticos y los vende por unidad. Una de las complicaciones que Mónica tiene son las enfermedades que produce porque algunas veces se encuentran con cosas químicas. 

Con el préstamo quiere adecuar un lugar en su casa para tener más espacio para poner cosas de reciclaje. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo para poder transportar mejor los plásticos.
texts.en:
Mónica P. is 50, and she lives in the outlying areas of the city. Her house is located in Paraíso de Guayaquil. She is not married, but she has two children. The 16 year old goes to public school, and the 25 year old attends the university. Mónica started a food business, but selling food in her area did not work out for her. She started to recycle tops, bottles, and plastics. She finds all of these things in the main dump of Guayaquil. She now recycles tops, bottles and plastics. She sells them by the unit. One of the complications that Mónica has is illnesses; sometimes she encounters chemical things. She wants to use the loan to adapt a place in her house to have more space to put the recyclable things. In the future she wants to buy a vehicle to be able to better transport the plastics.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tops, bottles, and plastics

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es: El señor Juan tiene la edad de 44 años, habitante del barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua, casado, con dos hijos estudiantes, su esposa trabaja de secretaria en el ministerio de educación. Don Juan se desempeña como contador,  desde hace veinte años, el cual logro terminar una carrera técnica debido a que sus padres eran de pocos recursos económicos. Para el ha sido difícil poder terminar su casa ya que ahorrando junto con su esposa lograron comprar un terreno en donde han venido construyendo poco apoco, aun le falta levantar las paredes totalmente de su vivienda, como hacer baño y el inodoro ya que no están en las mejores condiciones de higiene pero le ha sido difícil poder hacerlo ya que todo esta caro y a pesar de su salario fijo de ambos se le ha hecho dificultoso ya que la canasta básica esta muy costosa. Es por eso la necesidad de este financiamiento para poder terminar de cerrar su casa y hacer el baño que le urge ante de la temporada de invierno. Lo que mas quisiera es poder terminar su carrera en la universidad para poder tener mejores beneficios en su trabajo. Da las gracias a la institución por dar este financiamiento el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, piedrin, tablas, clavos entre otros y poder comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Juan is 44 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of the capital, Managua. He is married and has 2 children who are both students. His wife works as a secretary in the Ministry of Education. Juan has worked as an account for 20 years. He was only able to finish technical studies because his parents had few financial resources. It has been difficult to finish building his house. He and his wife saved enough to buy land where they have been constructing their home little by little. They have yet to complete the walls and the bathroom, which aren't in the best condition. But it has been difficult to do this because everything is very expensive. Despite their salaries, the cost of living is very high. This is why Juan needs financing to finish his house and bathroom before winter. What he would like most is to be able to finish his studies at a university level, which would allow him to get more out of his career. He thanks the institution for this financing, with which he will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, gravel, tiles, and nails, among other materials. He will now be able to finish building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, gravel, tiles, and nails to finish construction on home.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Mrs. Nary T. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Ny Tem, live in a small village along National Road Number Two about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1985 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The elder son is a photographer and the other children are in school. Nary has been selling grocery items for more than 15 years. She buys them from Takhmao market for re-sale at her home. Mr. Ny Tem has been selling fruit for more than 10 years. He buys the fruit from the market in Phnom Penh for re-sale at Takhmao market. Nary asked for a Kiva loan one time already; she now is applying for another loan of $500 to repair the house where she lives. To see Nary's previous loan, click here.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives

loans.name: Sadita

texts.en:
Sadita is a member of LAPO micro-finance; she borrows and repays on time. She is 48 years old and is married with five children.

Sadita sells groceries like sweets (candies), biscuits (cookies), tomato paste, soap, and baking items. She started the business six years ago and she likes doing the business as it gives her an opportunity to interact with customers.

Sadita opens her shop every day from Monday to Saturday and manages the business with the help of her children, especially when they are on holidays. She does this to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Sadita is asking for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more groceries and baking items in bulk as this will enable her get a better discount and so earn more profit. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and baking items in bulk to sell

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Mrs. But L. is a low-income person living in a rural area of Kompong Tom, a province of Cambodia, where she earns a living by rasing many pigs in a pigpen next to her house. She has been running this business for many years. By doing this, she has been able to generate a lot of profit to feed her kids, ever since they were young.

But L. was married, but divorced her husband. She now has seven children, three of whom are married and live independentL. and the remaining four are single. Four of the children are employed at different jobs and provide their small income to help contribute to the famiL..

But L. is taking out her loan to construct a step for her house and will use the rest to accumulate more piglets for her pig-raising activity.

loans.use: To construct a step for her house and to accumulate more piglets to raise

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Сафарова Шахло проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж на зарабатках в России. Сама Шахло предоставляет услугу. Она в основном занимается пошивкой национальных платьев. В этой области более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа метериала.
texts.en:
Shahlo S. lives in the Vose district. She is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. Her husband works in Russia. Shahlo provides sewing services. She is primarily involved in sewing national dresses. Shahlo has been in this business for over 5 years. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

Juliana, tiene 67 años, es casada y tiene siete hijos, ella vive en la comunidad D. Inquilpata del distrito D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta D. comestibles y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta D. queso, leche y venta D. animales menores, ella venD. sus productos en el Campo Ferial D. la Comunidad Campesina D. Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

Juliana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar detergente, arroz y muchas cosas más. 
 
Juliana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juliana, 67, is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank. She is married and has 7 children. She lives in Inquilpata, Anta district, Cusco department. Her main commercial activity is food sales but she also sells cheese, milk and small farm animals at Friday’s Inquilpata-Anta Farmers Market. Juliana is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and to proviD. the best for her family through her own daily efforts. She needs funding to buy detergent, rice and many other things. Juliana is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy detergent, rice and many other items.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is from the village of Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City. She is 52 years old, married, and has one school-aged child and six adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business providing electronic services, such as computer and video karaoke, to local community members. Evelyn is just starting this business.
In 2010, Evelyn joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional capital for her entertainment business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and support her children's education. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital of her  entertainment business

loans.name: Francia

texts.en: Francia M. is from the village of Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 54 years old. Francia is married and has four grown children. Francia owns and operates a livestock business. The main source of income for her business comes from raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Francia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Francia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old. She is a married mother of 4 children ages, 7, 9, 12 and 18 years old. All the children are attending school.

She is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. She has been farming for 10 years and has employed 2 people on a temporary basis. Her products are beans, potatoes, maize and milk which she sells to the local market. Elizabeth is also employed and owns some rental houses in Nkubu town.

Her major challenges in farming are diseases, lack of enough feed for her cows during dry seasons and labor shortages.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 47,700 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will assist her to pay school fees for her children and improve their health and standard of living. In 5 years time she plans to expand her dairy farming by adding 2 more dairy cows.

She is grateful to Juhudi for their efficient services which are helpful to the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zansi Martine

texts.fr: K. Zansi Martine est née le 30 Juin 1961 à Djeffa dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Martine est mariée à HOUESSOU Gabriel, un menuisier. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. C’est depuis quarante neuf ans que Martine habite le quartier Djeffa. Martine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants, et assure avec son mari les charges de la famille. Martine n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis vingt ans environs, Martine vend divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, bougies, savons, conserves, sachets, piles, sucre, éponge, insecticides, etc.) à son domicile. C’est la première fois que Martine demande un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et donc se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
K. Zansi Martine was born on June 30, 1961 in Djeffa in the township of Sèmè-Podji. Martine is married to HOUESSOU Gabriel, a carpenter. The couple have six children, some of whom are enrolled in school. Martine has been living in the Djeffa neighborhood for 49 years. She lives with her husband and children and helps her husband support the family. Martine was not able to attend school. For about 20 years, Martine has been selling various items (pasta, candles, soap, tinned goods, plastic bags, batteries, sugar, sponges, insecticides, etc.) out of her home. This is the first time that she is asking for a loan from ALIDé, in the intention of bolstering her business and growing her clientele, and thus her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for resale (pasta, candles, soap, tinned goods, plastic bags, batteries, sugar, sponges, insecticides, etc.)

loans.name: Min's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Min E. is 57 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members. They are located in Meun Trea village, Kandal province. The members of this group loan will use the funds to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Min E. is a farmer who works very hard to support her two children. On the farm she owns a 1-hectare piece of land on which she cultivates rice that she sells, for a living. In order to support this farm, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming laborers. Mrs. Min E. is widow with two children, both are seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for farming labor.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine M. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Geraldine owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Geraldine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yorn

texts.en: Yorn Y. is a 35-year-old married man and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Phnom Penh. Yorn Y. owns a piece of farmland that he bought many years ago from his nearby neighbor. He uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. He has a life partner in his wife who appears in the photograph and earns a living selling vegetables. Yorn Y. planted rice crops two months ago, but his crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, he would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer. Yorn Y. intends to use any remaining money from the loan to accrue capital for his wife's business.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Mrs. Fe G. is from the barangay of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years of age, married, and is blessed with two children who are still at minor and infant ages. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. Her husband also manages their own PUV (public utility vehicle) route for Ozamiz and Tangub City with an average net income of not less than $23 a day. She has been engaged in her variety store business for five years already and earns approximately $68 a month from this business activity. Aside from that, the couple is also earning from their two motor cabs for hire.

In the year 2009, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, she has successfully repaid a loan of 35,000 PHP. She is now requesting an amount of 50,000 PHP as her 2nd loan, to be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions, including meeting her basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children's education, insurances and possible business expansions. 

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari store business

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Handicapé physique, Mr A. Yao est né en 1973 à Gapé Tsikalé dans le Zio. Après ses études primaires, il se lance dans de petites activités génératrices de revenus. Finalement il s’est consacré à la fabrication et à la vente de paniers. Il fabrique lui-même les paniers et les revend aux bonnes femmes commerçantes. Malheureusement ses moyens financiers dérisoires ne lui permettent pas de produire suffisamment pour répondre à la demande des femmes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de disposer des moyens afin de fournir régulièrement ses clientes.
texts.en: Handicapé physique, Mr A. Yao est né en 1973 à Gapé Tsikalé dans le Zio. Après ses études primaires, il se lance dans de petites activités génératrices de revenus. Finalement il s’est consacré à la fabrication et à la vente de paniers. Il fabrique lui-même les paniers et les revend aux bonnes femmes commerçantes. Malheureusement ses moyens financiers dérisoires ne lui permettent pas de produire suffisamment pour répondre à la demande des femmes. C’est pourquoi il sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de disposer des moyens afin de fournir régulièrement ses clientes.

loans.use: fabrication et  vente de paniers

loans.name: Da Maris Elieta

texts.es:
El clienta Da maris Elieta S. R.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león Kilometro 105 Carretera león San Isidro. Madre Soltera  trabaja actual mente en MINED santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como maestra de educación  secundaria tiene 10 años de estar laborando en esta institución. Esta clienta tiene 1 hijos a su cargo 
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para Compra de cemento y arena, para la mejora de su vivienda,  esto le permitirá tener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en: The client, Mrs. Elieta Solis R., lives in the municipality, Santa Rosa Del Penon, in the Community of Leon, at the 105th Kilometer point along the Leon San Isidro Highway.  She is a single mother that currently works at MINED Santa Rosa Del Penon as a teacher of secondary education.  She has worked at this school for over 10 years.  She has 1 child and owns a one-bedroom house that she would like to improve.  She plans to use her credit towards the purchase of cement and sand, in order to fix up her housing and thus improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Purchase cement and sand.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Mrs. Meriam J. is from the Barangay of Silangit, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and married but separated. She has one dependent child. To make a living, she has a business selling Avon Products and ready-to-wear clothing. She also receives support from her parents for her basic needs. Meriam has had her business for a year, earning an average amount of P3,000.00. 

In 2009, Meriam joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is a member of Paglaum MPC and, under the Regular Loan Program, has successfully repaid a loan of Php5,000.00. She is now requesting a loan of Php5,000.00 as her second loan which will be used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, savings for future use, loan repayments, her child’s education, and possible business expansion.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Capital for her Avon products and clothing business

loans.name: Guistaco Group

texts.es: Julio Cesar H. M. tiene
texts.en: Julio Cesar H. M. has

loans.use: Purchase iron and hand tools

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M. is a 60-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture:  a pig-fattening  business. She lives in Prk. Cogon, Brgy. Guinsay, Danao City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000.  Estrella is now borrowing PHP 16,000 so that she can purchase an additional pig. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.

 Estrella aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase an additional pig

loans.name: Madougou

texts.fr:
Madougou S. est une veuve a plus de 63 ans qui réside avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants chez leur défunt époux à Mancourani II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette dame s’est initiée aux activités de petit commerce  tels l’achat-vente des pagnes wax, des tissus brodés, de chaussures, de tasses, de parfums etc depuis  maintenant plus de trente ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes des localités environnantes et son activité marche en merveille. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante et exigeante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de sept ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, il est à son onzième prêt individuel, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursé.Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 30 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 complets de tissus brodés, 10 paires de chaussures plastique, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso et souvent dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Madougou S. is a widow who is over 63 years old.  She resides with her co-spouse and their children in their deceased husband’s house in Mancourani II, the downtown of Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to advance in school for societal reasons, this lady became familiar with small-scale commerce, such as the buying and selling of wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered cloth, shoes, basins, perfumes, etc.  Madougou has been in this business for over thirty years.  She is in high demand, especially by her customer base (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her products.  She receives many orders from the surrounding towns.  And her business is doing wonderfully.   Concerned with satisfying further her growing customer demands, Madougou decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over seven years ago. After several solidarity loan (group loans) in a women’s association in her district, she is now on her 11th individual loan. All the preceding loans have been properly repaid. She plans on using her loan to buy 30 bolts of wax pagnes, 15 outfits of embroidered fabrics, 10 pairs of plastic footwear, etc. She gets her supplies in Bamako and then she resells them door-to-door in and around Sikasso. With this loan, Madougou envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for helping to cover family expenses and paying the loan interest. The rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: Buying pagne cloth, embroidered fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo A. is from the town of Palayan, Aloran. He is 39 years old. Alfredo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Alfredo makes a variety of food products and sells them in the community. Alfredo has been engaged in his business for more than three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alfredo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Alfredo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alfredo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia M. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old and married. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Virginia also raises ducks and sells their eggs at the market, and manages a corn farm. 

Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to buy piglets and feeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba F. is divorced and has 6 children. She has received schooling through Middle School. Aba has been selling porridge in Abrafo, near Abura, for 12 years. She uses her income to pay for utility bills and her children's school fees and books. Aba will use the loan to purchase more maize for preparing the porridge she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to continue expanding her business by preparing more porridge and, as a result, serving more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to make porridge

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Kadiatu K.. She is married and has four additional dependents who live with her because she takes care of them. Kadiatu owns a plastic wares business, which she inherited from her late aunt. She began the business because she wanted to make a profit. 

Kadiatu operates her business six days a week and ten hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic items

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son V. N. is 37 years old.  He has a grocery shop in Kim market. He has run this kind of business since 2004, and he has quite a stable income to cover his family's expenditures and pay school fees for two children who are at high school and secondary school.

Mr. Son joined in our credit program in 2004 and has always been a good repayer. To buy more goods to meet the demand of customers, he wants  to have a  loan of 9,810,000 VND. He said that this kind of loan is very suitable for his business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar M. is from the village of Umayco, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 44 years-old. Oscar is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Oscar owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing coffee, rice and meat grinding services to local community members. He is also making and selling chorizzo and longganisa or home made sausage. Oscar has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Oscar joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oscar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and to provide working capital. Oscar is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed for making chorizzo and longganisa. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Oscar from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed for making chorizzo and longganisa.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia forma parte del banco comunal “Los Bendecidos” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto. Ella vende mote con huesillo en una feria rotatoria cercana a su casa, desde hace 7 años.
