Trabaja allí 5 días a la semana y le ayuda una hermana que la acompaña 2 veces a la semana en la venta, pero sin ninguna ganancia económica.
Con este préstamo Leticia comprará huesillos.
El sueño de Leticia es comprar un vehículo para tirar su carro, ya que queda muy agotada cuando lo traslada de lugar.
Su negocio es su único sustento económico, ya que vive sola en su hogar.
A Leticia le han servido mucho los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha adquirido cosas necesarias para su negocio como por ejemplo una máquina conservadora, la cual utiliza para mantener el jugo del mote con huesillos fresco y helado. Además también le han servido las enseñanzas sobre administración de su negocio que recibe durante las reuniones junto a sus compañeros de Fondo Esperanza.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Leticia is part of the “Los Bendecidos” (The Blessed) Communal Bank in the town Puente Alto .  She has been selling “mote con huesillo” (a sweet drink / dessert made with peaches) for seven years at a traveling fair that is close to her house.

She works there five days a week.  One of her sisters goes with her and helps her with sales twice a week.  She does this without financial gain.

Leticia will buy “huesillos” (sun-dried peaches) with this loan.

Leticia’s dream is to buy a vehicle to pull her cart.  She is very exhausted when she moves from one place to another.

Her business is her only financial support because she lives alone in her house.

The loans from Fondo Esperanza have helped her a lot.  She had gotten the things she needs for her business.  For example, she got a cooler, which she uses to keep the mote con huesillos juice fresh and cold.  They have also helped her with the education about business administration that she gets during the meetings with her colleagues from Fondo Esperanza.

Puente Alto is a town north of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  It was founded as a rural town at the end of the 19th century.  Given its growth, it is currently one of the most populous towns in Chile with over 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the gateway to one of the foothill areas of the Metropolitan region, which is known as 'Cajón del Maipo' (Maipo Canyon). This area has spaces where people can hike, ride horses, raft and take part in other activities. It also offers lodging and food services.

loans.use: Food: Sun-dried peaches

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 28 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Amarildo de 30 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Robert de 11 y Miguel de 6 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Sonia en sus chacras, ha hecho que sus sembríos de arveja y gladiolo sean uno de los mejores cultivados del poblado de Patay. Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que es muy importante que las tenga bien cuidadas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para tomar sus propias decisiones, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta la ciudad de Tarma. En adelante, espera comprará nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Es el octavo crédito con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y siempre es aconsejada por el resto de las socias. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 28, is a humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Amarildo, age 30, and their two beloved children, Robert (age 11) and Miguel (age 6), for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Sonia works every day in her fields, tending to her pea and gladiola crops, which are known for being the best cultivated in the village of Patay. Every morning, she leaves very early to go work in the fields because she knows that it is very important that her crops receive good care. What she enjoys most about her work is having the freedom to make her own decisions. Sonia has been farming for eight years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the city of Tarma. Going forward, she hopes to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. Sonia feels obligated to submit her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for her Communal Bank. She is well-respected and always providing advice to the other members. The loan of 1500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to improve her crops.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old married man living with his wife and four young children who are still attending school. He has been working as a home painter for the past 20 years. He works on a freelance basis taking on home projects. His income is vital to support his family and be able to pay the heavy expenses of life. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a mini-van for his work. In that way, he will benefit from making his transportation faster and easier especially since he serves customers located in different areas and villages. He hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly to earn good income for his family. In the future, he is planning to open his own shop where he can sell house paint and all related tools.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-van for his work.

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es:
Denis, reside en San Jorge departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 6 años de edad, se  dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, desde hace 15 años, aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días, de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, pues se dispone a sembrar maíz y frijol, este préstamo le ayudara a obtener todo lo necesario para realizar la siembra y algunos de los riesgos es por el ambiente, todo depende de cómo este el invierno.
Él aspira tener este trabajo por un largo tiempo, que sea rentable para poder ayudar a su familia y más que todo a su hijo, para que crezca y sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Denis lives in San Jorge, in San Miguel department, together with his wife and 6 year-old son.  He grows corn and beans and has been doing this for 15 years.  He learned from his father and works every day from 6.00am to 3.00pm.

Denis needs this loan to buy manure and fertilizers as he is preparing to sow corn and beans.  This loan will help him to obtain everything he needs to sow his crops.  Some of the risks he faces are weather related.  Everything depends on how severe the winter is.

Denis aspires to remain in this line of work for a long time and for it to be profitable so that he can help his family, especially his son who he would like to see grow and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald S. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Ronald has a butcher shop business, which he has run for six years. He also has a second business running a restaurant.
To help expand his business, Ronald has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more meat for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ronald hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, married to Lilian, and they have one child. 

John runs a barber shop as his primary business and also sells clothes to customers who are mostly area residents in Mathare estate in Nairobi.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd., which he plans to use to buy more stock  of clothes for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to improve his family's standard of living.

In the future, he plans to work hard and ensure that his business grows. Eventually he would like to set up a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mahounato Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUNATO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Raymonde est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Raymonde est née en 1972 au Bénin.  Raymonde est une veuve qui vit seule avec ses enfants. Raymonde a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa  charge. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Raymonde vend depuis quinze ans des tissus, des basins, des bijoux. A côté de cette activité, Raymonde vend des séries d’assiettes dans une ville du Bénin. Raymonde s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Ghana, État voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Raymonde sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUNATO, un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
The MAHOUNATO group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s fourth time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

Raymonde, the group’s representative, is seen in the photo with her hand raised. She was born in Benin in 1972. Raymonde is a widow, and she lives alone with her five dependent children who all attend school. 

To support herself and her children, Raymonde has been selling fabrics, bazins and jewelry for 15 years. As a sideline, she also sells plates in a city of Benin. She gets her merchandise in Benin and in Ghana, a country neighboring Benin. 

In order to meet the needs of her customers and increase her profits and revenue, Raymonde is seeking this fourth loan together with the other members of the MAHOUNATO group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, jewelry and plates for resale

loans.name: Philis

texts.en: Philis is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children who are five and 11 years old. For the last eight years, she has worked hard at making a living by selling clothes. Before starting her own business, she was a housewife, but by joining Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save money and manage her business. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business into a much bigger operation. Her dream is to own an apartment which she can live in and use as an office. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Senda De Amor Group

texts.es: Maria Concepcion tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijas y un hijo, reside en la Aldea San Nicolas, y es miembro y coordinadora del Banco Comunal Senda de Amor. Doña Maria inició vendiendo nacatamales y ropa de segunda mano, y desde hace unos años se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de rosquillas y quesadillas. Ella se levanta muy temprano por la mañana para iniciar su jornada laboral, dos de sus hijas le ayudan a mezclar todos los ingredientes mientras ella prepara el horno, y una vez que sale el producto horneado, una de sus hijas le ayuda a entregarlo. Por la venta de su producto obtiene una buena ganancia pero cuando llueve mucho le va mal porque la leña se moja y no le da buen punto al pan y este se pasa de tiempo. Ella aprendió a realizar su negocio porque observaba a otras personas hacerlo y tambien las ayudaba para agarrar practica. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar materia prima como harina, azucar, huevos, soda, leña, etc. Y con lo que venda ella podrá seguir sosteniendo a su familia y tambien podrá ahorrar un poco para responder ante cualquier emergencia. Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijas para que cada una de ellas tenga su propio negocio y puedan ganarse la vida honradamente. En la actualidad FAMA ha impartido a sus clientes cursos sobre Panaderia y Reposteria y Doña Maria asi como sus compañeras de grupo se han beneficiado, por tal razón ella iniciará a diversificar su negocio con productos como pasteles y otros tipos de panes.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is 43 years old. She is a single mother and has three daughters and one son. She lives in the San Nicolas village and is a member and coordinator of the Senda de Amor (Path of Love) Community Bank. Mrs. Maria started by selling nacatamales and used clothing, and for the past few years works making and selling rosquillas and quesadillas. She gets up very early in the morning to start her day's work. Two of her daughters help her mix the ingredients while she prepares the oven. Once the products are done baking, one of her daughters helps her deliver them. Through the sales of her products she is able to make a good living, but when it rains a lot she is not as successful because the firewood gets wet and the bread does not bake well and then gets overbaked. She learned this business by watching others do it and they also helped her practice. She needs this loan to buy supplies like flour, sugar, eggs, soda, firewood, etc. With the products she sells she will continue to support her family and also save a little for any emergency that may come up. She dreams of supporting her daughters so that each one has her own business and can earn an honest living.

FAMA currently provides its clients with courses in baking and pastries and Mrs. Maria and her other group members have learned from these courses. For this reason she will introduce more products to her business, such as cakes and other types of bread.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, eggs, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a widow and lives with her brother and sister. She works as a teacher at a nearby school where she gets income on a monthly basis. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her nephew who operates a mobile shop in the market. Through his shop, he sells new and used mobile phones as well as mobile accessories at reasonable rates. 

He is very good in his customer dealings and earns a reasonable income every month. With this loan, he will buy mobile phones and accessories to put in his shop. 

Naseem is very hopeful that after the loan investment her nephew's income will be increased and it will help him have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and salt. He is a Ugandan male, aged 43 years, who hails from the Kyenjojo district. He is a retailer and a father of 4 children, aged five to sixteen years old. He lives together with his wife and children. 

Joseph has been in this business, operating the retail shop, for seven years. With the proceeds of his retail sales, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Limited capital limits his business plan and in the future he wants to start up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora Miriam tiene un puesto de venta de maní azucarado; esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar en mayor cantidad maní y azúcar, fabricar el producto, embolsarlo y venderlo. Es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta será la cuarta vez que su solicitud de crédito es enviada a Kiva para fondeo.
texts.en:
Sra. Miriam has a stand where she sells sugar-coated peanuts. This business provides a source of income by which she can support her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy peanuts and sugar in bulk so that she can assemble, package, and sell her product. Miriam is married and has two children. She lives in a rental property in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time she has requested a loan, which is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth, 56 years old, is married and has 2 children. She lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. Ruth has been farming for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fertilizers for her farm. Ruth has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future,she hopes that she can earn a lot from her farm and business with the help of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Bendia Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENDIA (4 femmes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles à MANA, un des quartiers de la ville de OUELESSEBOUGOU (2ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbon de bois et de bois de chauffe.  DANAYA, la présidente du groupe fait l’achat et la vente de charbon et bois.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 sacs de charbons de bois et deux chargements de charrettes en bois e chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne à MANA et villages environnants auprès des paysans et effectue ses ventes au  marché de OUELESSEBOUGOU et à domicile, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the BENDIA group are four married women who average 39 years of age and five children each. They live in traditional families in MANA, a district of the city of OUELESSEBOUGOU (2nd administrative region of the republic of Mali). This is their second collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers. 

They sell charcoal and firewood. Danaya, the group’s president, plans to use her loan to buy ten bags of charcoal and two cartloads of firewood. She gets her stock from peasants in MANA and surrounding villages, and conducts her sales from her home and at the OUELESSEBOUGOU market, at retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of both men and women.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA, which she will use to help her husband with daily expenditures. The remainder will be reinvested in her activities.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Profiteza

texts.en:
Profiteza is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Profiteza has a videoke or karaoke shop that provides karaoke services costing five pesos per song. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for utilities like electricity for maintenance of her business.

Profiteza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Profiteza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for utilities like electricity.

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
Cliente de 38 ans, mariee et mere de 4 enfants dont l'age varient entre 4 et 16 ans. En 2000, elle se lance dans le commerce des habits et chaussures  .
Etant parmi les premieres clientes de Hope , elle a beneficie maintenant de son 4eme cycle de pret, elle a une forte capacite de remboursement et a des epargnes considerables;
Pour ce pret elle veut renforcer le stock de ses marchandises, des robes pour enfants, ensembles pour garcons, des chaussures ,baskets et autres articles.
Ses ventes sont de 50000frs a 150.000 frs par jour,et avec ses benefices, elle a ouvert une boutique et effectue souvent des voyages a Cotonou et Kinshasa pour aller s'approvisionner.

Pour l'avenir, elle pense etre grossiste et ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
This client is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children ranging in age from 4 to 16. In 2000, she began selling clothing and shoes. Among the first clients of Hope, she is now on her fourth loan cycle, she is good at repaying her loans and has considerable savings.
This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, such as dresses for children, outfits for boys, sneakers, and other items. She has 50,000 to 150,000 francs in daily sales, and with these profits she has opened a boutique and often travels to Cotonou and Kinshasa to buy more stock.

In the future, she would like to be a wholesaler and open a department store.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear outfits for children and women, and also shoes.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 39 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She has three children. For the past eight years, Milly has been working hard to manage her salon, which styles hair and does hair extensions for local clients. 

To help expand her business, Milly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair care supplies, and will help Milly to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Milly hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a training school for hair dressing. 

Milly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Milly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more hair care supplies

loans.name: Tabutha

texts.en:
Tabutha is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Tabutha has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Tabutha has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items for sale and will help Tabutha generate greater profits and provide for her family. Tabutha hopes that in the future she will be able to have a big business and educate her children. 

Tabutha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tabutha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Sonia tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Salvación y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Su principal actividad económica de Sonia es la venta de comestibles y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Sonia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercedaria como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más.    

Sonia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Sonia belongs to the “Tesoritos del Manu” communal bank and the bank’s meetings are every thirty days in the city of Salvación in Manu Province, Madre de Dios Department.

Sonia is 34 years old and in a common law relationship; she has four children.  She was born in the city of Salvación and that’s where she carries out her commercial activities.  Her main activity is foodstuffs sales in a home-based grocery store.  She’s been in this business for several years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Sonia needs the loan to buy stock merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles and other things.  Sonia is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy  more stock items for her store.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es:
La Sra. Yoli pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor de Café”, del Distrito de Soritor, Provincia de Moyobamba y Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 35  años y tiene 03 hijos.
Por iniciativa de su mamá incursiona en la fabricación del almidón y sus derivados ya que su mamá se dedicaba a lo mismo. Actualmente vende sus productos en Moyobamba, Lima y en su mismo distrito pues goza de clientela fija. Además vende chupetes (helado de hielo),  gelatinas  y flan. Considera a su esposo como su mano derecha porque le ayuda mucho.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará calaminas, sacos de yuca, más tinas y dará la inicial para comprar un rayador de yucas, para continuar brindando una mejor calidad de su producto y una buena atención a sus clientes. 
La Sra. Yoli es una mujer trabajadora,  su sueño es adquirir una finca para poder sembrar yucas, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Yoli belongs to the “Flor de Café” communal bank in Soritor District, Moyobamba Province and San Martín Department.  She has a spouse, is 35 years old and has three children.

Through her mother’s initiative she went into the manufacturing of starch and its derivatives since her mother was in the same line of work.  She currently sells her products in Moyobamba, Lima and in her own district because she has a fixed clientele.  She also sells ‘chupetes’ (frozen treats), gelatin desserts and flan [custard].  She considers her husband her right hand because he helps her very much.

She will use this new, 2000 sol, loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, sacks of cassava and more tubs and will pay the down payment to buy a cassava scraper to continue providing the best quality product and customer service.

Yoli is a hardworking woman.  Her dream is to acquire a farm to plant cassava.  She’s very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement.

loans.use: to buy cassavas, galvanized metal sheets and tubs.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is 40 years old. She is not educated as her family's financial situation did not permit it. She is the mother of three children: one daughter and two sons. She doesn’t want her children to have the same destiny as her which is why she has enrolled all her children in school. 
   
Rubina's husband's income relies on his meat business. He runs a butcher shop where he sells red meat (goats) to his customers. His clients come from among his community and his friends. Every month he makes good sales figures and generates a good revenue. He has been working in this business for more than ten years.

To improve the finances of the business and increase their clients, Rubina has asked Kiva partner, Asasah, for a loan. Her husband will use the loan to purchase goats so he can sell their meat. 

She hopes that this investment will have a positive financial impact on the business and that the family will be able to use their increased income to improve their well-being.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell in a butchers shop.

loans.name: Thérèse Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Cliente âgée de 51ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants , elle  a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de crédit.

 Il ya 17ans, elle ouvre un petit restaurant à domicile, non loin de l'aéroport.
Son restaurant ouvre très tôt , ses clients sont les manœuvres qui travaillent non loin de l'aeropport et   les taxi mans, elle fait des menus de  bouillons de la viande de porc ,  du mouton et de l'haricot a la sauce tomate.
Ses recettes journalières sont comprises entre 50000F et 200000F .
 Elle a remboursée ses prêts sans défauts de paiements et a fait des épargnes considérables .

 Avec l’actuel prêt, elle va acheter : 10 kilos de viande de mouton, 10 kilo de viande de porc, 1 carton de poisson salé, 1 panier  du poisson fumé  1 bidon de 10 litres d’huile, 1/2 filet d’oignons, 1carton de cubes, 20 boites de tomates  concentrées, 1sac de charbon, du 10 paquets fagots de bois de chauffe,rajouter  les ustensiles de cuisines. 
Pour le futur , elle pense a ouvrir un grand restaurant parce qu'elle a une grande clientèle, elle s'occupe valablement de sa famille et participe activement au bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Maman is 51 years old, married and mother to 10 children. She is a client of HOPE and is on her 4th loan cycle. Seventeen years ago, she started little by little to sell meals in her neighborhood. 

Her restaurant opens very early with the passers-by and from 12:30pm workers from the aeroport and surrounding companies. As well as grilled meat, she makes broths from pork and lamb meat and beans in tomato sauce.

Her daily profits are between 50000F and 200000F after paying salaries. 

She has paid back with savings to move on to the next loan cycle of the united group.

With the actual loan, she is going to buy: 1 sheep, 1 pig, 1 carton of salted fish, 1 basket of smoked fish, 1 10L can of oil, 1/2 string bag of onions, 1 carton of cubes, 20 boxes of tomato concentrate, 1 bag of coal, 10 bundles of sticks of wood for heating, reinforce the plates, forks and spoons.

Her prices are affordable and she attracts clients with varied and special menus. Her goal is to open little restaurants in the other neighborhoods.

People call her: mother boss.

loans.use: to buy 1 pig, 1 sheep, salted fish, smoked fish, can of oil, 1/2 string bag of onions, tomatoes in boxes, bag of coal, wood for heating, plates, forks, spoons, cubes, pepper, spices

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married to a farmer and they both live together with their one child at Enyinase. 

Ama buys fresh fish from the seashore and comes home to fry the fish to sell. She wants to increase the quantity of fried fish, so a loan will go a long way to help buy additional fish to fry and sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Unidas” están  en el Primer ciclo, con 14 integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy activas y responsables. Ellas está empezando a trabajar con la fundación y ven un gran futuro en el programa, ya que ellas con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda que obtienen dicen que podrá salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Ananias es la presidenta del grupo, ella comenta que tiene un despensa, la cual con mucho sacrificio ha podido levantar. Dice que empezó con una despensa chiquita, pero que con el tiempo pudo crecer y aumentar u poco su negocio, hoy en día, la mayoría de sus vecinos ya la conocen y ya tiene muy buena clientela e ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, hortalizas, pan, leche y demás artículos de primera necesidad, los cuales tienen mucha venta. Agradece una vez más por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee is called "Mujeres Unidas" [United Women] and is in its first loan cycle, with 14 members. The group stands out in its neighborhood for being very active and responsible. They are beginning to work with the foundation and see a great future in the program since with their effort and the help they receive they say they can get ahead and help their families. 

Ananias is the president of the group. She comments that she has a grocery store that she has been able to establish with much sacrifice. She says she started with a tiny grocery store, but with time was able to grow and expand her business a little. Today the majority of her neighbors know her already and she already has a very good customer base and income. 

She is seeking the loan for the purchase of meat, greens, garden vegetables, bread, milk and other staples, which sell well. She gives thanks once again for this opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase meat, greens, vegetables, bread, milk and other items.

loans.name: Martita

texts.es:
Martita es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 30 maños y junto a su esposo trabajan muy duro para poder sacar adelante a sus 2 pequeños de 8 y 4 meses de edad, ya que son el regalo más grande que Dios le ha podido dar y sobre todo porque los ama muchísimo. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pucallpa, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se encuentra ubicada en la selva peruana, en la cual hay flora y fauna bellísima y sus paisajes son hermosos. Cuando dispone de un tiempito libre le encanta salir a pasear con su familia y también le encanta en ocasiones disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo   “Patarashca de Pescado”. 

Con  mucho empeño Martita atiende día a día su negocio de alquiler de mototaxi, así como también vende parrilladas los fines de semana, con lo cual apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar; ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y los fines de semana o cuando hay alguna festividad en su ciudad puede trabajar hasta 10 horas; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo tiene muy buena sazón para la preparación de platillos.

Martita está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que  gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para colocar un techo afuera de su vivienda para su negocio de parrillada,  ella podrá comprar calaminas, clavos, listones, entre otros, ya que en su ciudad hay lluvias de manera continua, lo que le permitirá dar mayor comodidad a los clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, así ella podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener un negocio más grande”.

loans.use: Para la compra de calaminas, clavos, listones, enter otros

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: A foodstuffs seller. Mrs. Rose I. at Uwelu Quarters (a semi-urban area in Nigeria) is a dedicated and credit worthy poor woman. She plays major roles in her family up- keeping and proud to be a LAPO client because LAPO made her what she is today. She needs the above amount for her business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia has a small variety store where she sells cosmetics and school supplies. She began the business with her husband's help; he motivated her to start the business with 100 dollars.

In the beginning she only sold pens, notebooks, sweets and soft drinks. Now she continues to offer those products, along with clothing and gifts. She would use the loan to buy a variety of merchandise at wholesale prices. Lucrecia has faith that her business will grow thanks to the variety of products she'll be able to offer her clients.

Lucrecia is 30 years old and married. She has 4 children, all in school. She is certain that her business will grow and allow her family to get ahead. Lucrecia hopes that this loan will help her build her home and give her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Lucrecia tiene un pequeño bazar donde vende cosméticos y útiles escolares. Lucrecia empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien la motivo para que emprendiera el negocio con 100 dólares.

Al principio sólo vendían plumas, cuadernos, golosinas y colas. Ahora continúan ofreciendo estos productos junto con ropa y regalos. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar variedad de mercadería a precio de mayorista.

Lucrecia tiene fe que su negocio crecerá con la variedad de articulos que ofrecerá a sus clientes. Lucrecia tiene 39 años unida, tiene cuatro hijos todos estudian. Ella esta segura de que su negocio crecerá para salir adelante con su familia. Lucrecia tiene la esperanza de que este préstamo le ayudara ahorrar para construir su vivienda y darles educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy a variety of merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is approaching Mifex in order to receive a second loan from the Kiva program. She has done well with the loan she received. She initially used the money to boost her inventory for the upcoming Christmas season. She was able to significantly increase her profits and she has put much of the money away in savings. Although she planned on opening a new point of sale with her first loan, she recognized the immediate opportunity to increase profits during the holiday season and she chose to postpone her plans.

Angela owns a shoe store in Guayaquil, Ecuador. She has owned her business for about 9 years. She started the business with her late husband who passed away several years ago. It was very difficult for her to continue on without her business and life partner, but she has endured through the hard times. She feels very proud to know that she has been able to succeed with the help of her daughter. She is requesting this loan because she wants to set up a new point of sale managed by her daughter. She hopes she can use the money to rent some space and invest in products.

loans.use: Try to set up a point of sale for her daughter to run

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
José Luís is 32. He is married and has a 4-year-old girl. They are originally from Creel, in the state of Chihuaua. He used to do small carpentry jobs, working from house to house, but his lack of tools cost him the best jobs. Using his savings, and with hard work, he converted part of his home into a carpentry shop, and now he makes furniture of all types.

Right now, José Luís needs a loan of $150, which he would use to buy specialized tools for making furniture. These tools will shorten the time he spends in making his furniture and improve its quality. He expects to repay the loan in one month. The family sincerely appreciates your contribution in expanding the business and improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

José Luís tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene una pequeña hija de 4 años, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Creel en el estado de Chihuahua. Anteriormente él realizaba trabajos pequeños de carpintería casa por casa, contaba con muy poca herramienta lo que le impedían elaborar trabajos de mejor calidad, pero con base en su esfuerzo y ahorros ha logrado acondicionar un lugar de su casa para utilizarla como taller de carpintería, ahora elabora muebles de todo tipo.

En estos momentos, José Luís necesita un préstamo de $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de herramienta más especializada para la elaboración de los muebles, esto le permitirá reducir su tiempo de producción y mejorar la calidad de sus productos, él ofrece devolver ese crédito en un meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y contribuye a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: An industrious woman who know the usefulness of a loan to her business, Esther is a member of LAPO's union. She is 35 years old and a widow with five children. She sells iced fish in the open-air market and has been in the business for the past 10 years. Esther hopes to buy more iced fish for resale if the loan amount of US$ 250 is granted to her.

loans.use: To buy iced fish for resale

loans.name: Maimounatou

texts.fr:
Born in Mango and aged 45, Mrs. Maïmounatou A. is married and is the breadwinner for 5 other persons. Her husband, who is a driver, is not able to contribute to supporting the family because his earnings are meager. The whole financial responsibility rests on Mrs. A., who manages to support her family on income from retailing charcoal, maize (corn) etc. Since this is not sufficient income, she has decided to expand her business and sell wholesale. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of US$ 400. Being able to expand her business will permit her to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Mango et âgée de 45 ans, Madame A. Maïmounatou est mariée avec à sa charge 5 personnes. Son mari chauffeur n’arrive pas à contribuer aux besoins de la famille à cause de son maigre revenu. Toutes les charges reposent sur Madame A. et elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins grâce aux revenus de la vente de charbon, maïs, d’igname. Ceci étant insuffisant elle décida d’agrandir son commerce, en devenant grossiste. Pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de $400. Le fait d’agrandir son commerce lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of foodstuffs and charcoal

Stockage et vente de vivres et charbon

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
At Moree Junction near Cape Coast is a well-known carpentry shop called “Talented Creative Furniture.” The owner of this business is Mr. Philip Q. who makes all kinds of furniture for both private and public organizations, schools, and his individual clients. Philip has eleven apprentices studying under him. He is 36 years of age and married with three children ages 11, 9, and 5 years. His wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, milo, and soap.

He is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group.” The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they provide support for each other as they are all located at the same place – Yamoransa – on the Accra Highway.

One challenge Philip faces is that organizations and individuals always ask him to make furniture for them, but because of the high cost of wood, foams, leathers and the materials used, he sometimes loses his customers to his competitors because they have been able to secure loans from some financial organizations. As a result, Philip needs a loan of US $1,100 to purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails and the material used to manufacture the furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails and the material used to manufacture furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Rufullu

texts.en: Rufulla is 45 year old trader who has been selling men clothes in the central Sabirabad bazaar for nine years. He brings in clothes from different countries which is why his goods are of high quality and sells very quickly. He is married and has three daughters. This business is the only financial source in his family and he tries very hard to cover all of his family's needs. Rufulla plans to increase number of clothes he brings in from abroad. To expand his business he has applied for a 1200 USD loan.

loans.use: To increase number of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in different types of products for his store

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia works at her husband’s company, carrying out sun parasols repairs, in order to sell them at the local market. Each week she buys the metal framework of the parasols and her husband repairs these frames, she then verifies that they are acceptable. Once acceptable, she puts bright and gaudy color fabrics on them. This daily activity and the sale of the parasols at local markets allows Cecilia and her family to survive. However, the family struggles and they wish to improve their difficult economic situation. Cecilia and her husband would like to form a business where they could sell parasols wholesale, so that their 3 children can continue to study and in the future become business professionals. Cecilia remembers that 12 years ago, she started working with her husband in parasols. She says they have always overcome the problems that happen to business folk like low sale, little profit, among others. In spite of these hardships, they are very happy because they believe that have a unique position in the market as one of the most important producers of parasols, which they think will be an advantage to their future sales. Cecilia wants to increase the production of their parasols and therefore needs increased capital, hence needing a loan. Please help this self-sacrificing mother get what she so longs for.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

Cecilia, trabaja en compañía de su esposo, realizando reparaciones de sombrillas de sol, para luego venderlas en el mercado local. Cada semana compra el armazón de metal de las sombrillas y su esposo se dedica a reparar estos armazones y ella a verificar que estén bien, luego de haber culminado este proceso les pone telas de vistosos y llamativos colores, día a día esta actividad permite que Cecilia y su familia tengan el sustento diario ya que depende del trabajo de toda la semana, la venta de las mismas en las ferias locales. Los deseos de que progresen en familia y mejoren su difícil situación económica la motivan a que tenga como meta formar una empresa y poder vender al por mayor estas sombrillas, a fin de que sus 3 hijos puedan seguir estudiando y a futuro se conviertan en grandes profesionales. Cecilia recuerda que hace 12 años empezó a dedicarse junto a su esposo a esta actividad y que con la constancia de ambos han superado los problemas que siempre aparecen cuando uno es comerciante, como las bajas ventas, poca ganancia, entre otras a pesar de estos inconvenientes están muy contentos porque se han posicionado en el mercado y son conocidos como uno de los proveedores de sombrillas más importantes y para ellos esto se ha convertido en una ventaja para sus ventas. Ella desea aumentar la producción de sombrillas y para esto requiere de un aumento de capital para lo cual solicita un préstamo. Posibilitemos su petición para que esta abnegada madre consiga lo que tanto anhela.

loans.use: Capital Gain to Increase Weekly Production.

loans.name: Sre Ompel Ii Group

texts.en: Mr. Song S. is the Village Bank President of Sre Ompel II Village Bank, which consists of 28 members in the Kandal Province. He is 46 years old and is a subsistence farmer who usually works on a rice field. He is married with eight children, three of whom are working while the others are enrolled in school. His wife, Mrs. Srey NE. Chhom, is a housewife and she normally helps her husband work in the field. Because his family is very poor and because he has an insufficient number of farm equipment and draft animals, he is hereby requesting a loan to hire a laborer with draft animals to plow his rice field. With the remaining loan proceeds, he would buy fertilizer for the field.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with an animal to plow the rice field and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Moza's Jipe Moyo Group

texts.en:
Moza, age 36, is married with three children (ages 12, 15, and 5). She runs a small shop where she sells vegetables and general items, working from 7am to 9pm daily. From this business, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $70.

Moza hopes for a loan to purchase more inventory for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who live in her locality and are all members of loan group Jipe Moyo. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her small shop

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina C. is a merchant who has owned a small grocery store for the past four years.  She is married to Favio Apariz who works in construction.  Her family consists of the parents and their three children.  Thanks to the hardworking spirit of the couple, the family has two sources of income, which allows the children to study at the university. 

Agustina would like to offer her children the opportunity to be great professionals in the near future since neither she nor her husband had the chance to study. 

Agustina needs the loan to invest in merchandise to offer a greater amount and variety of products to her customers. 

 Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Agustina C. es comerciante, ella posee una despensa desde hace ya cuatro años. Esta casada con Favio Apariz que trabaja como albañil. La familia esta constituida por la pareja y sus tres hijos. Gracias al espíritu trabajador que poseen ambos, la familia cuenta con dos fuentes diferentes de ingresos. Gracias a esto, los hijos pueden ir a la universidad. 
Agustina quiere brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de ser grandes profesionales en un futuro próximo, ya que ni ella ni su marido tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar.
Agustina necesita el dinero del crédito para poder invertir en mercadería para poder así ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor cantidad y variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, flour, noodles, soft drinks, milk, eggs and other products

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Huyên, 52 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She is an active and responsible woman that handles all household duties. Her husband was in the military but has lost his strength and now receives and receives a monthly stipend. Her family is currently living in the countryside. The people living in this area depend entirely on agriculture as a source of income. With their firsthand knowledge of farming necessities, her family borrowed capital to invest in the business of selling fertilizer.

Her family's farming supplies business needs a lot of capital to prepare for the different seasons. The fact that their region has very few businesses like theirs has been beneficial for the family. Therefore, her family's business has been the main source of farming supplies for the people in the area.

She has four children - one has a family and three still live with her. Of the three remaining, one is attending school and the other two are working to supplement the family's income.

For this round of loans, the family wants to raise 9,000,000 VND to invest in their fertilizer retail business. Their average income is 4,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese, by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Huyên 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006 chị là người phụ nữ năng động, đảm đang lo toan mọi cônng việc trong gia đình, chồng chị là cán bộ mất sức có lương hưu hàng tháng, gia đình chị hiện đang sống ở vùng nông thôn, người dân ở đây nguồn thu nhâp chính hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào nông nghiệp. Nhận thấy nhu cầu không thể thiếu của người dân làm nông nghiệp gia đình chị đã vay vốn đầu tư kinh doanh vật tư lân đạm. Với việc kinh doanh vật tư nông nghiệp gia đình chị cần nhiều vốn để đầu tư mỗi khi vào vụ, rất thuận lợi cho gia đình chị tại địa phương có rất ít người kinh doanh mặt hàng này, vậy cửa hàng nhà chị luôn là điểm mua bán của rất nhiều bà con trong địa phương.Chị có 4 con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình, 3 con đang sống cùng chị, 1 con đang đi học, 2 con đã đi làm và có thu nhập phụ giúp gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào kinh doanh vật tư lân đạm. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To invest in their fertilizer retail business.

loans.name: Johari's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Johari is 27 years old. She is a married woman with three children aged 8, 6 and 2. She also takes care of one other child, aged 5. She has been a tailor and a used clothes saleswoman since 2006. Every day, she works from 6.30am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Johari now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and tailoriong items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with juice sales, charcoal sales, and clothes (bedsheet) sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Dasirah

texts.id: Usaha jual nasi goreng yang dijalani Dasirah (46) sampai saat ini masih berjalan lancar. Saat ini Dasirah sudah melunasi pinjaman yang pertama, dan bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman yang kedua yang nantinya akan dipakai modal untuk mendukung usahanya, seperti membeli bahan untuk nasi goreng berupa sayur dan bumbu, dan ada juga yang dipakai untuk memperbaiki sarana usahanya yaitu gerobak dorong. Dari pinjamannya yang pertama, Dasirah sudah mengalami peningkatan dari segi pendapatan harian dari Rp.50,000 per hari menjadi Rp.100.000 sekarang ini. Dengan semakin meningkatnya usaha jual nasi goreng miliknya, dia bisa melunasi pinjaman yang pertama sebelum masa pinjaman berakhir. Dasirah berharap, dia diberi pinjaman yang lebih besar untuk mengembangkan usahanya ini.
texts.en:
Dasirah's (46) fried rice business is running well so far. Currently Dasirah has paid off her first loan and wishes to apply for a second loan which will be used for additional capital to purchase ingredients in a form of vegetables and spices as well as to fix her pushing cart. From her first loan, Dasirah already increases her earning from 50,000 IDR to 100,000 IDR* per day. As her business grows, she was able to pay off her first loan even before it was due. Dasirah wishes that she could get a bigger loan to expand her business. *1 USD is roughly 9,000 IDR

Translated from Indonesian by Arliadi (Ludi) Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Adding working capital

loans.name: Bahrinisso

texts.en: Mrs. A. Bahrinisso lives in the Spitamen region. She grows and sells cucumbers, tomatoes, rice and wheat. Her 5 children help in this family business. Mrs. A. Bahrinisso applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 3800 STJ ($1125 USD) for 6 months.  She will use the loan for seasonal work to ensure a good crop next year.

loans.use: seasonal work to ensure the success of next year's crop

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 41 años, vive en L. actualidad con su esposo, 4 hijos y 1 D. sus nietos. Diariamente lleva a su ganado vacuno para ser alimentados directamente D. los pastizales que elL. tiene, también cultiva productos oriundos D. su zona, este ritmo D. trabajo lo hace desD. su niñez, ya que proviene D. una familia netamente agricultora, lo que heredó D. sus padres, no ha dejado D. hacer, por lo cual se siente muy satisfecha. Sus cosechas las  comercializa directamente en los mercados centrales D. L. ciudad D. Huancayo, esta ardua labor L. ha transmitido a sus 9 hijos, hoy sólo los 4 menores siguen con elL. y son su gran ayuda para cuidar D. sus animales y evitar posibles robos. Después D. hacer engordar su ganado, lo oferta en el mercado ganadero. Rosalía se esfuerza por querer ver su familia en mejores condiciones económicas. Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá comprar sacos D. abono y sembrar otra extensión adicional D. alfalfa para su ganado.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 41 years old. She currently lives with her husband, 4 children, and one of her grandchildren. Daily, she takes her herd of cattle to eat directly from the pastures that she has, also growing products native to the area. This rhythm of work is what she has done since her childhood, as she came from a family in agriculture. It is what she inherited from her parents. She has not stopped doing it because she feels very happy. Her harvests are sold directly in the markets in the center of the city of Huancayo. This hard labor is shared by her 9 children, though today only 4 young ones continue to live with her and they are a great help in order to care for her animals and to keep possible thieves away. After fattening her herd, she offers them for sale in the market. Rosalía works because she wants to see her family in better economic positions. She is asking for this loan with which he would be able to buy bags of fertilizer and grow an additional area of alfalfa for her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her fields, also to increase her alfalfa planting

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La sra.Francisca se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de café, te, leche y sandwiches, en la calle Sagárnaga, una zona muy comercial de la ciudad. Vive en la Av. Las Delicias de la zona de Villa Fátima. de la ciudad de La Paz. Es viuda desde hace mucho tiempo por lo que ella sola se dedica a la crianza de su hija, quien le ayuda en el negocio y también en los quehaceres de la casa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de insumos para le venta de café y también invertirá en comprar productos para la venta durante las fiestas de fin de año. Es cliente muy responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
For 15 years, Francisca has sold coffee, tea, milk and sandwiches on Sagárnaga Street, a big commercial district in the city. She lives on Las Delicias Avenue in Villa Fátima, near the city of La Paz. She has been a widow for a long time and is solely responsible for raising her daughter, who helps with the business and the household chores. The loan will be invested in the purchase of supplies for the coffee shop and merchandise to sell at the end of the year festivities. She is very responsible and punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Asha B., a 45-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is married and has two children, who are 10 and 26 years old, respectively. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting another dependant (an orphan--his parents did not care about him, so Asha took him into her family).

Asha has been operating a beauty salon since 2006. At her beauty salon, customers are able to buy any type of hair (long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, or blue hair) for their head, then have such hair attached to their heads, woven, cut, or braided, and finally made to look like their own hair. She works at her business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week, though she is assisted by 2 employees. By doing so, Asha is able to earn approximately $600 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to buy more salon products (e.g., weaving materials, short hair, long hair, and curly hair). In the future, she plans to increase her inventory of hair care products. Asha thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional salon products (e.g., weaving materials, short hair, long hair, and curly hair)

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.es: Maria Alejandrina Martínez quiere un préstamo para impermeabilizar su casa el cual en temporadas de lluvias se gotea y no quiere que sus mubles se deterioren con la humedad. Como se observa en la foto se ven manchas que esta provocando la misma humedad en techo. Ella solicita la cantidad de $7,000 pesos
texts.en:
Maria Alejandrina Martínez would like to ask for a loan to make his home watertight as there are several leaks during the rainy season and she doesn’t want the furniture to be deteriorated by humidity. As it can be seen in the picture, there are several water stains in the ceiling. She is requesting for $7,000 Mexican pesos ($525).

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make home improvements

loans.name: Simon

texts.fr: Originaire de Ganvié,village lacustre, Monsieur M. Simon est âgé de 40 ans,il n'a apprit aucun métier et a été initié dès son adolescence à la pêche par son feu père. Marié à M. Philomène,il a 7 enfants dont le dernier s'appelle Guillaume. Il ne vit que de la pêche ,et depuis quelques années,il  a ajouté la vente de produits de réparation de barque:peinture noire,pointes et tôles.Il sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ces diverses activités.
texts.en:
From the lakeside village of Ganvié, Mr. Simon M., age 40, did not learn a trade, though at a young age, he was introduced to fishing by his late father. He is married to Philomène M. and has seven children; the youngest is named Guillaume. He makes a living from fishing. And a few years ago, he included the sale of boat repair materials: black paint, points, and sheet metal. He is requesting this loan to bolster these diverse activities.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fishing (such as nets and other materials)

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is 26 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children. He has been a farmer for the past 3 years. He began with the goal of supporting his household and above all to satisfy the needs of his children. For Hamza, agriculture is an activity that he likes to do. Vegetable growing is what he enjoys most, as it is easier to cultivate these plants, which are harvested annually and the produce is profitable. The earnings are greater when buyers purchase the production in great quantities. The expense of transportation can also be avoided when buyers come to harvest and take them away the produce themselves. Hamza is requesting a loan to invest in seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. Be an important part of the growth of Hamza’s business. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Yên năm nay 53 tuổi . Gia đình chị có 3 con đã trưởng thành và đã đi làm.  Năm 2002 chị Yên tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.  Hiện tại đay vẫn là công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị. Ngoài ra hàng tháng 3 con của chị đều hỗ trợ thêm cho gia đình 2.000.000đ/ tháng nên cuộc sống của gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 13.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. NguY. Thi Y. is 53 years old. Her family has three grown children who are working. In 2002 she joined TYM Fund to borrow loans to invest in raising pigs. Currently, this provides her family its main source of income. Each month, her three children's financial contribution totals 2,000,000 VND per month, making her family's economy quite stable. She would like to borrow 13,000,000 VND to invest in more pigs and feed for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 47 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Nabil has been working as a car repairer for twenty six years. He paints cars as well and he sells spare parts for cars. He requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and spare parts for cars. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face the competitive prices. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Phong

texts.en: Phòng Thị Ngô was born in 1965 ( no: 010105040021). Her main job is farming and in addition she is also a shift worker. She has a income daily of about 60.000 VND. She wants to borrow 2,436.000 VND ( or 140 usd) over a six month period to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.en:
V. Ngo Thi is fifty years old and lives in the town of Hung Nguyen.  She is married and has four grown children.  To make a living, V. owns and operates a manufacturing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling iron products to local businesses and community members.  V. has been engaged in this business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $285 a month from these activities.

In 1999, V. joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities.  V. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to invest in expanding her business.  V. is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase machinery to expand the business.  This will be her tenth loan from TYM Fund.  V. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery to improve the business.

loans.name: Litty

texts.en:
Litty S. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 44 years old. Litty is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Litty owns and operates a business venture in the food sector: operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Litty has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Litty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Litty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Litty is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Litty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Отуной кредитуется для расширения своего бизнеса продажи обуви.Она благодаря своей кредитной истории смогла увеличить свой доход и улучшить семейное положение.
texts.en:
Otunoy is requesting a loan to expand her business selling shoes. Because of previous loans, she has been able to increase her income and improve her family's situation. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: продажа детской и женской обуви

loans.name: Kalisizo South Nakiwala Polly Group

texts.en: N. Polly is thirty-eight years old, married with two children, one going to school. She has been dealing in the banana business for one year. She is using the loan to purchase bananas in, great volume, for sale. This will help her to meet her customers’ demands. N. Polly is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase bananas in bulk, for resale.

loans.name: Kafule A Monica Mayaja Group

texts.en:
Monica M. is a promissory business lady representing her group. She is thirty-five years old. Monica M. is widowed with four children, all at school, and she is taking care of two dependents, also going to school. She has been in the poultry business for over ten years.

Her stock is down and that is why she is requesting the loan to purchase more chicks, buy chicken feed, and drugs for quality poultry. She wants her stock to improve so that she can get good profits. She is a promising business lady whose dream is to build rental houses for income generation to help her children in future.

loans.use: Purchasing more chicks, buying chicken feed and drugs for quality poultry

loans.name: Bulubandi East Babirye Zaija Group

texts.en:
B. Zaija, age 26, has had a retail business for four years. She is using this loan to purchase items such as sugar, flour, biscuits, bread, cooking oil, soap, salt, candles, match boxes, etc. to add stock to her business. She is married with two children in school.

B. Zaija represents her group. She keeps on encouraging her group members to work hard. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to obtain a plot of land and to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items to add stock to a business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra dejugos enlatados y materia prima para alimentos

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 45-year-old mother of five. She braids hair and sells hair extensions. She loves this business because her hair extensions are in high demand and she likes satisfying her customers. Sarah is requesting a loan of 70,000 Nigerian naira (or about $475 US) to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Bebialen

texts.en:
Bebialen Villarosa is 23 years old, single, and residing at Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. Her livelihood and source of living is a barbecue food-vending business which she assumed from her mother.

Bebialen is a new member of PMPC and she joined the Co-op because of the good programs and services being offered. Right now she is applying for a loan of Php 20,000 as additional capital to purchase meat and ingredients for her business.

The profits of her business will be used for their living espenses and saved in the Co-op for her business’s future expansion.

loans.use: To purchase meat and ingredients for her barbecue-vending business

loans.name: Bethman

texts.es:
Bethman es un joven padre de familia que tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja (Norma), de 33  años, quien trabaja en un restaurante y a quien adora con todo su corazón, ellos tienen dos hijos: Chelsy de 10 y Jean Luca de 7 años.
A pesar de lo lejana que se encuentra su casa de la ciudad, cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes, en la que él mismo atiende a sus vecinos amablemente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta la noche, todos los días sin descanso. 

A Bethman le gusta mucho su negocio porque lo puede realizar en la comodidad de su hogar y además es muy rentable, ya que es la única tienda de por su barrio. 

Para un futuro no muy lejano desea mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y también surtirla con mayor variedad de productos. Bethman sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene recompensa, es por eso que día a día se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia y hace todo lo posible por mejorar en la vida. 

Por tal motivo se ha animado a pedir su primer préstamo con MFP y sabe que debe esforzarse y ser responsable para cancelar todas sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita mejorará las vitrinas de su tienda y comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bethman is a young father who is 31 years old. He lives with his partner Norma, who he adores with all his heart. Norma is 33 years old and works in a restaurant. They have two children: Chelsy (age 10) and Jean Luca (age 7).

Even though his home is located far from the nearest city, Bethman has a grocery store in which he graciously serves his neighbors. He is open every day without fail from 6 am until nightfall. He likes the fact that he can manage his business from the comfort of his own home. Since his store is the only one in the community, his business is very profitable.

In the near future, Bethman wants to improve the facilities of his store and also add a variety of products to his inventory. He knows that his efforts will be rewarded, so he strives every day to support his family and do everything he can to improve their way of life.

For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from MFP. He knows that he must be responsible and make his payments on time. With the money he requested, Bethman will purchase display cases for his store as well as merchandise in larger quantities so that he can provide better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cases & merchandise to expand his inventory

loans.name: Senior Quarters 1 Adoline Akao Group

texts.en: 45 year old Adoline A. is married with 10 children, seven of whom are in school. She also takes care of three dependents, two of whom are also in school. She works in the retail business that she has been running for over seven years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items, especially essentials like soap, salt, sugar, etc. At least now she is able to provide basic needs for her family. She wants to work very hard and obtain enough money to support herself financially and materially to become independent from borrowing. She wants to remain proud of her kiva loan that changed her lifestyle positively.

loans.use: To purchase retail items for her business

loans.name: Mrs. Mean Thoeun Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mean T. is a group leader of six people who all live in Sokram village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she owns a pig-breeding business. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Mean T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and pig food. Mrs. Mean T. has six children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn B.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting cassava to sell. She is 25 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the city of Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City. Jackelyn has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Jackelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Jackelyn is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is forty two years old. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim.
