Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Aisha is a trader. She trades in textile materials. She says she wants a loan to buy many kinds of textile materials. She sells in her community and treks to other nearby communities to sell on their market days. Aisha has been in business for three years.

loans.use: To buy textile materials.

loans.name: Tsienhorol

texts.en: Tsienhorol is 40 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All her three sons attend a local secondary school. Her husband operates a transportation service as well as a coal trading business in order to improve their quality of life. Tsienhorol, herself, operates a small grocery shop in her town with some help from her husband. She started her grocery shop in 2008 after conducting a consumer goods trading business for a while. Tsienhorol has found success with her new business and due to her good management has doubled her profits in just two years. Tsienhorol is focused on continuing her success in the future and says, "It is hard to live in Mongolia if you don't conduct your own business. Our shop is the big source of income for my family, so my dream is to continue to grow my business in the future." Tsienhorol is requesting a 700,000-tugrug loan to purchase grocery items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her shop

loans.name: Brenda De Los Angeles

texts.es:
8.	Individual: Brenda de los Ángeles R. A. 
Código: 04010651
Total: 8000	
Periodicidad: 32 semanal			 Fecha: 25-01-2010

Brenda de los Ángeles R. A. tiene una pequeña pulpería donde oferta desde granos básicos, carne, verduras, frutas entre otros productos de necesidad. Ella invertirá el crédito para comprar mayor cantidad  de productos y si es posible en nuevos especialmente en útiles escolares y papelería.
texts.en:
Brenda de los Ángeles R. A. has a small convenience store where she offers basic grains, meat, vegetables and fruits among other necessities. She will invest the loan to buy a greater quantity of products and, if possible, new products, especially school supplies and stationery.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more foods and new products for her convenience store.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Ángel (38) y sus dos pequeños  hijos; Jocelyn (13) y Luis (6).
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la confección de polos, buzos y chompas en el  pequeño taller que acondicionó en su casa. Allí trabaja con dos personas que le ayudan a realizar los pedidos grandes que le hacen algunos centros educativos. Recuerda que al principio trabajaba en un taller para otra persona, hasta que pudo ahorrar y empezar a comprarse sus propias máquinas y en la actualidad este productivo negocio le genera muy buenas ganancias. Aunque es cansado y algo rutinario, está muy satisfecha con los resultados porque le gusta y puede apoyar a su cónyuge en los gastos de la casa.
Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, con muchas ganas de progresar, para el futuro tiene planeado implementar el puesto que tiene en un mercado de su localidad con la ropa que ella fabrica y así espera empezar a vender lo que con tanto esfuerzo confecciona.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá con el pago de cada cuota con mucha responsabilidad. Pilar tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de material para empezar a confeccionar uno de sus pedidos grandes de buzos y chompas, con ello espera obtener muyt buenas ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Pilar, age 35, lives in her own house along with her partner Ángel (age 38) and their two young children, Jocelyn (13) and Luis (6). For five years she had been involved in the manufacture of polo shirts, track suits, and jerseys in the small workshop she set up in her house. There, she works with two people who help her fill the big orders that are given to her by educational institutions. She recalls that, at first, she was working for another person until she was able to save and begin buying her own machines. Currently, this productive business provides her with very good earnings. Although the work is tiring and sometimes tedious, she is very satisfied with the results because she likes it and is able to provide help to her partner with the household expenses.

As a very enterprising woman with a great desire to progress, for the future she has plans to open a stall in a local market with the clothing that she makes and, thus, hopes to sell what she manufactures with so much hard work.

This is the first loan that she has had with MFP, and she is certain that she will be very responsible and able to pay each installment. Pilar is planning on investing the money that she is applying for in the purchase of material in order to begin filling one of her big orders for tracksuits and jerseys which she hopes will provide very good profits.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for making clothing

loans.name: Jenny's Group

texts.en:
Jenny R. is from the town of Rizaluna Cordon. She is 23 years old. Jenny is the leader of a 6-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jenny R. group.

Jenny is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jenny owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Jenny has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a week from these activities.

In 2010, Jenny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenny is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Jenny's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en:
Germaine N. is 58 years old and lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is a widow and mother of 6 children. Madame N. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for twelve years and has paid back all her previous loans on time. She raises cattle, an activity which is very common in her village because there is a big agricultural market nearby. 

With the loan she will buy new cattle that she will raise and sell at the market. The revenues from this activity enable her to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle

loans.name: Mervin

texts.en:
Mervin G. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 39 years old. Mervin is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mervin owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling used clothing or 'ukay ukay'  in the local community. Mervin has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mervin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mervin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mervin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mervin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eliana Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí se reúne el Banco comunal Camino Del Progreso, en este banco la señorita Eliana L. es una de las socias, ella  converso con nosotros y nos comentó que esta muy agradecida con la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación para poder trabajar.

Eliana tiene 24 es una joven comerciante que tiene muchas aspiraciones, ella empezó en el  mundo de las ventas cuando tenía 18 años junto a su hermana ella fue quien la motivo para que trabajara, por motivo de la situación económica que estaban atravesando tubo que interrumpir sus estudios, el papá enfermo y ella junto a la hermana tuvieron que encargarse de los gastos del hogar, eso le hizo ser una persona responsable y decidió ingresar a la fundación, cuando en la ventas lo hizo con mercadería de ropa, pero en los actuales momento se dedica a vender productos de belleza con Avón y Yanbal como estos productos se vende según el pedido que haga el clientes mostrándoles la revista, y son pocos los días que le dan para que pague, ella decidió tener su propio capital y lo pudo lograr con los créditos que la Fundación le ha entregado, ahora esta joven comerciante puede comprar una variedad de productos y puede dejarles mas tiempo a sus clientes el crédito, un promedio de 35 clientes fijos ha podido reunir y que son muy responsables, hasta ahora no se ha atrasado con los pagos del  crédito.

Con este  nuevo crédito invertirá todo en productos como perfumes que son los que mas se venden y además bisutería para damas, el sueño de nuestra socia es tener su empresa de productos.
texts.en:
The “Camino del Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets in the city of Montecristi, Manabí province. Eliana L. is one of the members. She chatted with us and commented that she was very grateful for the opportunity that the foundation offers to be able to continue working. Eliana, 24, is a young merchant with many goals. She started in sales when she was 18 years old with her sister, who encouraged her to work. Because of the financial situation they were in, she had to interrupt her schooling; her father became ill and she and her sister had to take charge of the household expenses. This made her into a responsible person and she decided to become a member of the foundation. She started out selling clothing but now she sells Avon and Yanbal beauty products. Since these products are catalogue sales, she doesn’t have much time available between the time her customers place orders and when she has to pay for the products. So, she decided she needed her own capital and was able to secure it through loans from the foundation. Now, this young merchant is able to buy an assortment of products and is able to give her customers a longer period of time to repay her. She has an average of 35 regular customers that are very responsible; to date; she hasn’t been late with her own loan payments. She will use this new loan to buy products, like perfumes, which are the best sellers, and women’s costume jewelry. Her dream is to have a firm of products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Avon and Yanbal beauty products.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna P. is from the village of Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. Elna owns & operates a "habal-habal" (motorcycle taxi) business, providing services to local community members. Elna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Elna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Elna is requesting a new loan, her third, of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Gamaliel

texts.en:
Gamaliel T. is from the town of Rosales, Pangasinan. He is 48 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Gamaliel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community; however, the majority of his retail items are soft drinks. Gamaliel is just starting this business.

In 2010, Gamaliel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gamaliel is requesting his first loan, of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mila Rama Group

texts.en:
Mila R. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo. She is 40 years-old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mila is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a business selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mila is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Mila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Binta S. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15ANS1 depuis le 24 février 2002 et a 15 fois de suite reçu du crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux mener son activité. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Binta is a 43 year old woman. She is married and a mother caring for two children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of SAMBA 15ANS1 since February 24, 2002 and has since received 15 loans which she has never had a problem repaying. She fattens sheep and a new loan will allow her to better carry out her work. Her goal is to participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions, all the while strengthening her savings levels.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep for fattening

loans.name: Baï

texts.fr: Née en 1945, G. Baï vit depuis près de vingt cinq ans au quartier Akpakpa Dodomè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Baï est une veuve et mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous indépendants et qui ne sont plus à sa charge. Baï vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Depuis dix sept ans, Baï achète des poissons frais au port de pêche à Cotonou et les fume pour ensuite les vendre à domicile aux populations de sa localité. Baï a déjà obtenu de prêts à ALIDé et a bien effectué les remboursements. Dans le but d’agrandir un peu plus son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Baï sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1945, Baï G. has lived for about 20 years in the Akpakpa Dodomé neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Baï is a widow and mother of four children, all of whom are now independent and no longer in her care. She lives alone and pays the various expenses herself. For the last 17 years, Baï has bought fresh fish at the fishing port of Cotonou and smoked them for sale at home to the residents of her neighborhood. Baï has already received loans from ALIDé and paid them in full. With the goal of increasing her volume of business and better meeting customer demand, she is requesting another loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fresh fish

loans.name: Heikly's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heikly T. is 60 years old and is the village bank president. This group consists of eight members located in Prek Be village in Kandal province. The members of this village loan will use the funds to support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Heikly T. and her husband, Mr. Pavhy Tae, are farmers who work very hard to support their family's standard of living. With the farm, they own a plot of land to grow sapota (a tree fruit resembling plum or pear) for a living. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Heikly T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow sapotas. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy lamps and batteries for an electric machine. This couple has a child who is a farmer and also helps in the parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Ruth has a business of owning a textile boutique, which she has had for 4 years.  

To help expand her business, Ruth is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more textiles for sale.  Ruth hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to expand her stock of textiles.  In the future, Ruth hopes to open more locations for her business.

loans.use: To buy more textiles for sale.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim L. is a 49-year-old woman, married to Em Ros, aged 48. They have two school-aged children and earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Kim L. currently plants a rice crop, which she will harvest and sell when it is mature. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it may require fertilizer. Because of that, Kim L. has decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer, which she will use to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, which she will use to fatten her crop yield.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa A. is a married woman who lives in Relocation site, Sitio Cagay, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, food-vending, and farming. Marissa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. 

With the help of her past five loans, Marissa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 10000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing  20000 PHP to purchase more inventory for her general store and for farm expenses so that she can continue to save up for future house renovations. Marissa A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase new equipment

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa M. is a widow and has five dependents. She has no formal educational background. Adjoa sells bags of charcoal and firewood at Elmina. Adjoa uses her income in payment of school fees and utility bills. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase extra bags of charcoal for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to plough back her profit into her business.

loans.use: purchase extra bags of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Maricruz Mercedes

texts.es:
El clienta Maricruz mercedes G. C.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león del puente municipal 100 metros al Norte, Es casada  trabaja actual mente en MINED santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como maestra de educación primaria tiene 10 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de sin y madera para mejorar el techo de su Habitación.  Para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá que la clienta pueda obtener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
The client Maricruz Mercedes G. C. lives in the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, departament of León, by the municipal bridge 100 meters north. She is married and presently is employed at MINED, Santa Rosa del Peñón as a primary teacher. She has had this job for 10 years in this institution.

The client owns a house which she wants to improve. The loan will be used to buy zinc and wood to repair her home's roof. This will allow the client to have a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase zinc and wood to improve the roof.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina A., age 52, sells both food and daily-use products to the local community from her sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Elina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month. She and her husband have one grown child and live in the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. 
 
Earlier this year, Elina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Elina is requesting her first loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her shop

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala south region of Uganda.  She is married and has no children. Grace owns a retail shop, which she has had for three years.  She sells air time for phones.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sweets and drinks.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Grace hopes to own cows.  Grace is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: more drinks, sweets and sugar

loans.name: Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
Por mucho tiempo Elizabeth tenia un terreno en el centro D. la ciudad este solo le generaba ingresos por cochera, fueron una amigas que le dieron la mejor idea D. su vida ellas fueron desalojadas D. un mercado y al no tener a donD. ir le propusieron a Elizabeth les alquile su propiedad para poner el mercado, fue así que inauguraron el  mercado "SANTA ROSA"  donD. ella percibe alquileres mensuales con lo cual ella pueD. solventar sus gastos y vivir cómodamente, ahora esta proyectándose para techar una parte del segundo piso del mercado para alli construir cuartos para poder alquilarlos y D. esa manera tener otros ingresos, el prestamo que EDAPROSPO le otorga servirá para el pago D. un local  que quiere alquilar para D. ese modo iniciar el negocio que siempre ha querido, tener su propio restaurante uno D. sus grandes sueños por que le encanta la cocina ya cuenta con lo necesario  los utensilios y el mobiliario que es lo mas indispensable, esta muy animosa en este nuevo proyecto que espera concretar muy pronto,tambien se siente feliz D. formar parte del grupo "UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS" donD. ella se desempeña como secretaria.
 * Elizabeth esta con chompa verD. por otro lado aparecen 2 socias invitadas
texts.en: For a long time Elizabeth had a plot of land in the city center. Cars were parked on it and so she had some income from it. A few friends gave her the best idea of her life: they were evicted from a market place and, having no place to go, they proposed to Elizabeth to rent her plot of land to them and let them have their own market. This is how the Santa Rosa Market was established. Elizabeth receives a monthly rent which enables her to pay her bills and have a comfortable life. Currently she has a new project, namely roofing part of the second floor of the market and construct rooms for rent, and so have an additional income. The loan that was granted by Edaprospo will be used to rent premises where she will launch a new business that she has always wanted to have: her own restaurant, one of her big dreams. She loves cooking and has already all the necessary kitchen utensils and indispensable furniture. She is very spirited and hopes to make her new project come true very soon. She is also happy to be a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Group (United We Will Have Success), where she serves as a secretary. Note: Elizabeth is the lady with the green sweater. There are two invited members pictured with the group.

loans.use: To rent premises for her restaurant

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia J. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Lucresia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Lucresia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk food in the local community. She is also engaging in providing big trucks & other vehicles washing. Lucresia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucresia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucresia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Lucresia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lucresia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus needs a loan to buy manure for his tea plantation, which he has had for the last seven years.  He is a married man with ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He has a desire to invest in this tea plantation as a permanent scheme, and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy manure for tea plantation

loans.name: Meang

texts.en: Meang P., 45, is a housewife. P. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 10 per day. The family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month. P. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her child to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Monsieur Daouda C. est un homme marié et sans enfant de 24 ans qui vit dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Est  dans la préfecture de Kolondièba (troisième  région administrative de la république  Mali.
 Monsieur C. fait le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tissus etc. 
Afin d’augmenter son capital et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son deuxième prêt. Le premier a été bien remboursé et aux dates dues.  Sa boutique  sise  au marché de Kolondièba est très fréquentée.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 40 complets de prêt-à-porter, 30 pagnes de wax Hollandaise  et 100 paires de chaussures en plastiques et en cuirs.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako la capitale de la république du Mali. Avec une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, elle vend au comptant et souvent  à crédit.
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  50. 000  F CFA qui sera réinvesti dans la santé, nourriture et habillement.
texts.en: Mr. Daouda C. is a 24 year old married man without children who lives in a monogamous family in the Eastern District in Kolondièba prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  He has a business selling various articles, buying and selling clothing, shoes, fabric etc.  To increase his capital and satisfy his customers, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's  loan program. He is on his second loan, having paid the first loan on the dates due. His shop located at Kolondièba market draws many customers.   With this loan, he intends to buy 40 ready-to-wear outfits, 30 Dutch wax pagnes (a colorful West African cloth) and 100 pairs of shoes made of plastic or leather.  He gets his supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). His sales are in cash and often by credit to a clientele composed of men and women. He expects to make a monthly profit of 50,000 CFA. which will be reinvested in health care, food and clothing.

loans.use: To buy various articles

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a single mother of one.  She runs a retail shop so as to earn her daily bread.  She has been running the business for over ten years.  She also does dairy farming for extra income.  

Sophia appreciates Faulu Kenya because of their financial support.  This has made her able to improve her business.  She needs a loan of 60,000 Kes to purchase more sugar, rice, and cooking fat and to buy a cow.

loans.use: sugar, rice, cooking fat for her store and to buy a cow

loans.name: Kurison

texts.en:
Kurison O. S. Tanyai is 27 years old. He is married and a father of three children. He has been farming wheat for the last four years in Narok town with a good income. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan; he paid the first loan on time. He plans to prepare six acres for wheat planting. 


He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production. He hopes eventually to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land. Kurison is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To prepare six acres for wheat planting

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 33 years old and has five children between the ages of 5 and 15.  Currently all her school age children attend school.  Mediatrice's husband works with her in their general store, which they have had for ten years.  The business has allowed them to pay school fees and to buy a house for the family.

With this loan Mediatrice will purchase more stock, such as rice, sugar, bananas, potatoes, mineral water and other drinks.  If she and her husband make any profits with this loan, they plan to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar, bananas, potatoes, mineral water and other drinks.

loans.name: Fuerza Group

texts.en:
The 'Fuerza' (Strength) communal bank at FINCA Peru is starting its fourth loan cycle. Its 14 members have businesses selling groceries and preparing meats, among other things. 

Gloria is the president of the bank; she is 40 years old and has two children who are both studying. Gloria purchases cochineal (an insect used to make natural dye) and tara (a native plant used for tanning leather) at large local fairs, dries them at home, and then sells them in markets in Ayacucho and Huanta. 

She will be using her current loan of 700 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN) to purchase cochineal. She has had her business for over 10 years and has been a member of FINCA Peru for just as long. Gloria would like to have her own house one day, and invest her savings in a knitting machine, so that she can make sweaters to sell.

loans.use: to buy cochineal (an insect used to make natural dye)

loans.name: Nolmeshhuki Enole

texts.en:
Nolmeshhuki, 25 and married to Edwin K., a farmer, has been a wheat farmer for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES.3,000. Introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client, this is her first loan from KADET which she will use to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to generate profits from the loan which will go toward expanding into large-scale commercial farming.

Nolmeshhuki hopes she will live a better life in the future and see her children achieve magnificence.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes y también vende productos secos como trigo, cebada y maíz y también vende verduras, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar sus negocios de venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes y venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes y también para comprar verduras y productos secos al por mayor.
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 48, is married and has five children. She is a member of the communal bank  “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; the bank is located in the Zurite district of the Anta province which is part of the department of Cusco.

Sabina divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she also sells dry products such as wheat, barley, and corn; she also sells vegetables on the street. Sabina would like to expand her business and is seeking a loan to purchase inventory for the grocery store as well as to purchase vegetables and dry products from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for a grocery store and to buy vegetables and other products wholesale

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. is 33 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Harriet has a small retail shop business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Trust And Pay Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you the members of the “Trust and Pay” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 each, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Baindu is the leader of this group. Baindu is a 33-year-old, married woman with three children. Two of her children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Baindu sells bulgur wheat and rice and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Baindu will invest in her business by buying bags of bulgur wheat and bags of rice to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of bulgur wheat and bags of rice to add to her business.

loans.name: Danny Alex

texts.es: El señor Danny se dedica a trabajar con su vehículo como taxista desde hace un año  solicita el crédito para mejorar su vehículo ya que este tiene varios desperfectos, ya que en el estado en el que se encuentra no puede trabajar con regularidad y con el dinero hara reparar su movilidad,  vive en domicilio en alquiler, ya que el es oriundo de la ciudad de La Paz y se traslado a Cochabamba por motivos de trabajo, Danny  es soltero y colabora económicamente a su hermana para la manutención de los hijos de su hermana, anteriormente ya saco crédito en banca comunal demostrando puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas, es un joven solidario y trabajador agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Danny has been working with his vehicle as a taxi driver for one year.  He is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to his vehicle, as it has various imperfections.  He cannot work with regularity in the state it’s in and he will use the funds to make some repairs.  He lives in a rented domicile, as he is a native of the city of La Paz and moved to Cochabamba for work-related reasons. 

Danny is single and collaborates with his sister financially to help her support her children.  He has previously had credit at a cooperative bank, and demonstrated himself to be punctual with his installment payments.  He is a hard working young man, and is thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
To generate income for her family, Felisa decided to venture into the food-selling business. She sells fruits and vegetables house to house in her community. With the business she is able to earn an income of PHP 2,000 a month which she spends for daily expenses and for the expenses of her three children.

Felisa is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase variety of vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

In the future, Felisa hopes to own a stall in the market to make her business more profitable and generate more income to support her family and provide a better life for them.

loans.use: to purchase variety of vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Martina es natural de un pueblo pequeño llamado Panti, ubicado al este de la ciudad donde radica desde hace más de 20 años, en la actualidad vive con la menor de sus 3 hijos. Fue muy duro para ella afrontar las carencias económicas tras migrar a la ciudad donde emprendió con poco capital. Entonces se dedicaba en vender diversos productos de acuerdo a la ocasión y temporada, en la época de invierno vende  frazadas y mantas, también cubrecamas de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes; así como también elabora prendas tejidas a crochet. De manera paralela vende ovejas en la feria ganadera, así como su carne,  de acuerdo a la demanda de su cliente. Para martina durante estos años de experiencia vio la rentabilidad que le genera estas actividades por lo que no duda en continuar  trabajando de esta manera para mejorar siempre. A través de MFP solicitó siempre varios crédito que le han servido para crecer en su capital de trabajo donde siempre ha comprado más mercadería de la cual esta muy agradecida ya que considera que cuenta un buen aliado para el cumplimiento de sus objetivos personales. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en mantas y frazadas.
texts.en:
Martina is originally from a small village called Panti which is located to the east of the city where she has lived for more than 20 years.  She currently lives with the youngest of her three children (a daughter).  

Life was very hard for Martina who faced financial hardship after she migrated to the city.  She set herself up in business with just a little capital.  She sold a range of products according to the occasion or the season.  In winter, Martina sells blankets and also bedspreads depending on what her customers request.  She also crochets items.  In parallel with this, she also sells sheep in a livestock market, as well as their meat, depending on her customer demand.  Over the years, Martina gained experience and saw the profitability of these business activities.  For this reason, she doesn't hesitate to continue working in this way, so that she can keep improving.

Martina has requested several loans through MFP which have been useful to her in growing her working capital.  She has been able to buy more and more merchandise and she is very grateful for this as she believes she has a good ally who helps her in fulfilling her personal goals.  Martina will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying more merchandise (blankets).

loans.use: to buy blankets

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 43-year-old married father of one child aged 13 years. Alex operates a food cafe in Kilifi, a business that has been in operation for the last 14 years. He has been a KADET client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour for his restaurant.

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. Alex's dream and passion is to give his clients the best service and to eventually expand and open another restaurant in Kilifi.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour for his restaurant.

loans.name: Las Rosas Del Plan 3000 Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento " LAS ROSAS DEL PLAN 3000 " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 8  personas en la cual todas son mujeres ,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida,  promotora  de cosméticos , venta de bisutería   todas viven por la  zona del Plan 3000 de ahí el nombre del banco. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Ana, se dedica  a la venta de celulares, tiene 1 hijo, los ingresos que generan sustentan los gastos de su hogar y asimismo para la educación de su hijo ya que dice la Sra., que es su razón de vivir, es una Sra. muy buena responsable y dinámica de ahí que le escogieron como representante del grupo, con el dinero del crédito comprara celulares por mayor y cargadores, esta agradecida con la institución por su apoyo ya que sin ello no podría salir adelante.
texts.en:
The lending bank "Las Rosas del Plan 3000" is in its first cycle with the Institution. It has 8 members, all of whom are women. They have businesses including food sales, cosmetics, and jewelry sales. They all live in the zone known as Plan 3000 and that's how they named their group.  The group was founded at the initiative of 3 members; Ana, who sells cellular phones, has 1 son. The income that she generates covers the costs of their home and also her son's education, who she says is her reason for living. 

Ana is very responsible and dynamic and so she was chosen as the group's representative. With the money from the loan she will buy cell phones and chargers at wholesale. She is very thankful to the institution for its support because without it she wouldn't be able to move forward.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and chargers in bulk.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en: Darejan is from the village of Tskratskaro in the Imereti Region of western Georgia. She is 47 years old, married and lives with her husband, Amiran, and 29 year old son, David. Darejan is an agricultural produce trader. She purchases agricultural produce from wholesalers and sells them in Tbilisi, as well as nearby villages for higher prices. Along with the purchased produce, she also sells fruits and vegetables harvested on her family's 0.8 hectare land, as well as nuts harvested from 40 nut trees. Amiran and David are busy with their dairy farm – they have 2 milk cows, 3 calves and a bull. Amiran produces on average of 40 kg of cheese per month, which is sold by Darejan. The family's total average monthly income is 700 Laris. Darejan requested a loan to purchase agricultural produce for resale, which will increase the turnover of her micro-business and increase its profits, thereby allowing her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural produce for resale.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
33-year-old Maricar is a farmer who lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is married and has 2 children aged 9 and 10. Maricar's husband is also a farmer.

Maricar has been growing and selling rice for 5 years. She earns about 10000 PHP per month from farming. Maricar works hard to provide for her family's financial needs. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and gasoline for her tractor. Maricar is hoping to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and gasoline for her tractor

loans.name: Yader Alexander

texts.es: Yader Alexander tiene 23 años, su actividad es la venta de trofeos y elaboración, hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio. El es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable pues sabe que tiene hacerse cargo de su familia. Este negocio lo aprendió por su propia cuenta ya que anteriormente era obrero y solo ganaba por hacerlos, pero fue con el paso del tiempo que él decide establecer su propio negocio. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de plata, cintas, medallas, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Yader Alexander is 23 years old.  His business is selling and making trophies.  He has been in this business for more than two years.  He is a very hard-working and responsible man as he knows that he must take care of his family.  Yader learned this business on his own initiative as he used to be employed as a manual worker and only earned enough get by.  Over time, he decided to set up his own business.  He is requesting this loan to buy silver, ribbons, medals and other products.

loans.use: to buy silver, ribbons, medals and other products

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Ailyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in the store .
Ailyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ailyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: C 1683 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en:
Charles is 53 years old and married with seven children between eleven and twenty years old. He is the leader of the group called "TURWANYUBUKENE" in the local language, which means "fighting poverty." This group is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes. 

Charles has been in this business for about thirty years, and his business hours are from 6 am until 8 pm every day. He currently employs three people to help him. Charles is the last person on the left side of the picture.

Charles and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to cultivate more Irish potatoes to sell. With this loan, Charles and his team will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow them to keep reinvesting in their business for better financial stability. In addition to that, they will continue improving their families' lifestyles, and they will be able to buy cows to fertilize their fields.

loans.use: To cultivate more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing materials like cloth and needles.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Christopher has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas and coconuts. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

Christopher is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Christopher hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is a widow with one son. She lives in Zaporozhye city and sells men's and women's shoes. Ludmila has been in this business for 11 years. She is a hard-working person and a good entrepreneur.

Ludmila sells her inventories  at two markets different markets. She takes her inventory to a small city and sells there during the week. Then she goes back a market in Zaporozhye city and work there during the weekend. 

Ludmila would like a loan of 5,000 Gryvnas to purchase winter inventory. She can purchase it with a good discount and make more profit. This will help her to raise her son, since her business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase winter inventory.

loans.name: Johny Albey

texts.es:
El Señor Johny es un emprendedor quien inicia con el animo de su prima quien ahora es su socia, la idea de tener su propia distribuidora de platos para comidas rápidas, la cual se materializa con el deseo de independizarse del señor Johny y es así como con el dinero de su liquidación y sus ahorros se crea la distribuidora en la cual Johny labora solo en el horario desde 8:00 a.m y hasta las 9:00 p.m desde hace tres meses teniendo muy buena acogida en el sector.

Actualmente el señor Johny desea invertir el dinero en compra de productos al por mayor como pollo y productos desechables con el fin de acreditar su negocio y fidelizar sus clientes principalmente con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Johny is an entrepreneur who got his start with incentive from his cousin, who's now his business partner. The idea of running his own business distributing supplies for fast food materialized because of Johny's wish to become independent. Thus, with money from his severance pay and his savings, the distribution company was created. Johny has worked alone from 8a.m. to 9p.m. for the past three months and has been very well received in the segment. Currently Johny wishes to use the money to purchase wholesale goods such as chicken and disposable products so that his business can get a good reputation and gain the loyalty of customers. His goal is to improve living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale goods such as chicken and disposable products.

loans.name: Epripras

texts.en:
Epripras is married and has four children. She is 61 years old, and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. 

Epripras owns and operates a coco plantation, harvesting and selling coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She makes PHP 3,500 a month from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Epripras has been a member of GDMPC for a year. Epripras wants to save the revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa est une femme âgé(e) de 24 ans. Elle est marié à un frigoriste et ont 01 enfant.
Akossiwa travaille comme revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générales depuis 2008. Elle vend dans une boutique après achat au Grand Marché de Lomé. Sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Akossiwa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des marchandises pour mieux répondre à la demande de la population en cette période des fêtes.
Akossiwa voudrait accroitre son bénéfice pour pouvoir bien répondre à la satisfaction de sa famille.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 24-year-old woman.  She is married to a refrigerating engineer and has one child.  Akossiwa has been reselling grocery products since 2008.  She purchases her products at the Grand Market of Lomé and sells them in a shop.  Her main difficulty is a drop in sales.  In order to buy products that will better meet customer demand during the Holidays, Akossiwa has requested her first loan from WAGES.  Akossiwa would like to increase her profits in order to fulfill her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy grocery products.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Doña Josefa tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la aldea el caimito y se dedica a la produccion y venta de nacatamales, los nacatamales son muy sabrosos y se venden muy bien, para la epoca de navidad es una comida tradicional, ya tiene muchos encargados, pero tiene que aumentar su produccion, no quiere quedar mal con sus clientes y no tiene el capital suficiente para este proceso.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de los nacatamales.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Doña Josefa is 42 years old and lives in the El Caimito township where she devotes herself to making and selling  meat-filled tamales. The tamales are very tasty and they sell very well. It is a traditional food during the Christmas season, and she has many orders already, but she must increase production. She doesn't want to disappoint her customers and she doesn't have enough capital for this process. 

She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for making the tamales. She needs the earnings for covering household costs.

loans.use: to purchase corn meal, pork and chicken, vegetables, banana leaves, rice, olives, condiments and firewood.
